Reviews.Title: “great hotel for business next to the mall”
Reviews.Author: Moonbaby728
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel is very sheik. Check in was easy and the staff very friendly. My suite was huge with a full sitting area and separate bed room. My only MAJOR complaint that it was almost impossible to sleep at night due to the smoke alarm bright green light on all night right above the bed. That and the funky new age bright alarm clock made sleeping next to impossible. I ended up sleeping on the couch in the other room to avoid all the lights. If you visit this location I suggest you bring along some black electrical tape to cover the smoke alarm light. Room service was good as it should be for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon G
Reviews.Content: Booked for a last minute getaway and was pleasantly surprised. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Ted V
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel with beautiful rooms and a wonderful, I mean absolutely wonderful staff. No matter what time of day, or what request or question it was, they were there to help me out and get me what I needed. Jenna, the woman who checked me in over my four day stay, was a wonderful leader of the team, so I assume. She became my new best friend. She was always there to chit chat with me as I made my way between floors and rooms. Eli helped answer all of my questions at the end of my stay and helped me keep a look out for a very important client. Over all, the whole stay was hands down 5 stars, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Mindi M
Reviews.Content: I took a short trip to Dallas for my 40th birthday and stayed at Le Meridien because it was centrally located and close to the places I wanted to go. The room I stayed in was a Jr. Suite and it was gorgeous. It looked just like the pictures I had seen online, which isn't always the case with hotels. I opted for the pre-pay rate because it was almost $60 less per night, which made this an incredible deal. The room and bathroom were very spacious and CLEAN and decorated so cute (see pics). There was a large wall mounted TV that I loved. I ordered room service 3 times (breakfast once, dinner twice) and the food was incredible and the staff that delivered it was polite and professional. My room was cleaned each day, and I never noticed any noise at night. I slept like a baby. The parking is for hotel guests only, and I was issued a card on arrival. There was no additional charge for parking. It was truly like a mini vacation for me, and I'll never stay anywhere else when I'm in the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice change”
Reviews.Author: Chickenbiscuit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for three nights and enjoyed my stay. Room was fairly quiet with a view of the interior atrium. Very busy hotel. Somewhat standoffish check-in process as I requested a Starwood Preferred guest level room and was declined this request with no explanation other than the SP level was "pretty much the same" as the other regular floors other than having bottled water in the rooms. No biggie. Good room service, fast and friendly. Lots of reverberating slamming room doors early in the morning but in not sure how this could be avoided on the part of the hotel. All in all an enjoyable stay in a different, somewhat funky, chic little hotel. Nice change from the standard box hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Rollinstone1
Reviews.Content: Great room great location very nice lobby clean and good price

Reviews.Title: “Great price, spacious but NOISY rooms”
Reviews.Author: herb1968
Reviews.Content: I am in Dallas very frequently for work and for years have stayed at the Dallas Sheraton North but our company is now using Le Meridien instead. Decor is very nice-modern and my room was huge! The issue was the noise level in the evening/night. After a long day of travel I wanted to go to bed early but the noise coming from the bar/lobby area (although I was on the 8th floor!) was incredible and prevented me from sleeping until after midnight. The issue appears to be with the open concept hallways that allow all of the noise on the first level to travel up. Value was good for the money however overall.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay in central location”
Reviews.Author: bahtbahtgonegold
Reviews.Content: Excellent service by the entire hotel! Great leadership by GM Jennifer Richards. She sets the tone for a relaxing and lovely stay. Rooms decorated beautifully and very comfortable bed. They know how to make their guests feel welcomed and pampered. Excellent rates for a high end hotel! Would absolutely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Le Meridien - perfect location for business and play”
Reviews.Author: lorencondron
Reviews.Content: We just finished a spring break trip to Dallas and had a wonderful stay at Le Meridien by the Galleria. Our room was very spacious and contemporary with all the amenities we could ask for like a heated pool, jacuzzi, great gym and fast wi-fi (which is big for us). The staff was very welcoming and you couldn't ask for a better location. You are 100 yards from some of the best shopping in Dallas and have about 200 restaurants in a five mile radius. You can walk to Maximo which is high end Mexican and an amazing bar. From Le Meridien you are 20-30 minutes from anywhere you want to be in Dallas. Give Le Meridien a try and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..always clean”
Reviews.Author: AndriasMom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this location several times and always have a great time. One thing I really like is that it is very clean. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: busyme1
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel. I love how big the rooms are and it was spacious and chic. Very affordable. Im a starwood guest so we were on the top floor. That was my first time staying in dallas and next time i might stay downtown bc that is were i spent most of my time anyways. overall it was a nice hotel just wasnt the best location for me.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Trendy, Comfy and FUN!!!”
Reviews.Author: MusicalTravel
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to say about this place other than to say I really enjoyed staying here. Its visually appealing inside and certain was equally as impressive in the room. I got this beautiful hotel for $55 on Priceline!!! The Galleria Mall is right across the street...shopping and dining were real close! Things to be conscious of: PARKING FEES (however, during my stay the kind young lady at the desk waived the fee). THEFT (during my stay someones car was broken into on the paid parking lot). I loved the trendy decor and the spacious room environment, which included a sofa, ottoman, high desk which doubled as a dining table, huge tv's, spacious bathroom, etc. This place is somewhere I'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SassySouth
Reviews.Content: Love the location of this hotel across from The Galleria Shopping Center, Dallas. Staff was polite, rooms were large & had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay-not bad, definitely different!”
Reviews.Author: MistyZack
Reviews.Content: The hotel has modern art and decor. The executive suite is of moderate size, with a couch, king size bed, nice spacious bathroom, closet space, and a 42" TV. In fact the TV was the best by far of any of the hotels we have stayed at in size and picture quality. The king size bed is comfortable, but we did not like the soft down pillows, they were to soft for our comfort. The bed does not come with your typical sheet and blanket. You get the blanket which also takes the place of the sheet, a kind of combo thing. The AC worked wonderfully and kept us nice and cozy. We had one problem and that was a leaky toilet. We complained about it Saturday morning, since just a weekend trip, but still was not fixed when we left on Sunday. We were comped one day of parking for our displeasure. The hotel is not a 5 star hotel, nor would I rate it a 4 star. However, it is close to the Galleria. The Galleria was walking distance as in right in front of our hotel or better said our hotel was right behind the Galleria. So if you like to shop, then the cost to stay here is worth it. Also, the hotel is close to a major tollway and highway. The hotel is about two miles away from some great food choices, which is also a plus. We had a nice relaxing time and enjoyed the R & R.

Reviews.Title: “Barbara is the best”
Reviews.Author: r423
Reviews.Content: We have been dining with Le Meridien for the past two years and the main reason we keep coming back is Barbara the bartender. She is friendly, consistent and always makes our experience an enjoyable one. We always stay at the bar longer than planned simply because we enjoy the conversations with barbara. As for the food, nothing compares ! Such a great place overall. We will be loyal patrons for life !

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: RocioJohnson
Reviews.Content: I live in the neighborhood and enjoy having dinner and drinks at the Bar area. Love the decor it's chic and modern. Also the service Barbara provides is excellent and makes us feel comfortable and entertained. She has such a wonderful personality!!! The the food is delicious, compliments to the chef! I will definitely continue going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: NJ008
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby has modern decor. It is situated just a block away from Galleria, however it is not too far from some bad neighborhood. Check with front desk if you feel like walking in the evening, which direction "not to go". The rooms are specious with the modern decor. The bed was OK but pillows were least comfortable. I requested for another pillow but I was told that the hotel sold out and no softer pillows were available.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DonaldCleveland
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Le Meridien for our 13th anniversary. It was so nice and we were so pleased with the room. The room was clean and comfortable. The price was also good, at $104 per night. Our only complaints were the charge for parking. It's just an outdoor lot- why not include for free? Also I would liked the ice bucket filled each day. I left a note to that effect next to the tip, but it did not happen. Otherwise the service, cleaning, turn down, etc... was excellent. Olga did a fine job. We would definitely stay there again. Awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: AR-BRAY
Reviews.Content: The hotel was attractive. Our room was clean, and the staff was friendly. The hotel has a great location with many things within walking distance. The restaurant was good. We did have trouble with the lock on our room, but we were still able to get in and out. The room was large and the beds were cozy. The staff did tell us the breakfast buffet was open untill 11am, be warned this is for the weekend only and we were told this on a Monday morning so when we arrived at 10:30 we found no buffet. Although we were slightly irritated since I had called the front desk less than hour earlier to be certain of the buffet times, the restaurant staff was friendly. We ordered off the menu and were pleased with our meal. Over all a nice stay. The parking is a bit expesive, 18.00 a night but that might me common for the area.

Reviews.Title: “BEST AROUND”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice with a contemporary look. But what really makes this a top notch establishment is the polite prompful front desk staff of JENNA and NONA (Jenna helped me directly while Nona had her back with whatever was needed). They single handly turn what could have been a terrible stay and experence here, into one of enjoyment and pleasure. They conducted these corrections has fast has they possible could and had a smile on their face the entire time even throught the hicups. I Was very upset headed back to the front desk ready to leave the hotel with my complaints, and do to staff left the front desk with all my problems solved and will not stay anywhere ese but here for now on. THXS LADIES VERY PROFESSIONAL WHILE STILL BEING PERSONABLE.. B and M 1104 top floor :)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, modern rooms but not a high-quality experience”
Reviews.Author: FroggyB
Reviews.Content: Here's what we liked: -Lovely lobby, quick, trouble-free check-in. -Very nice, comfortable lounge area; everyone seemed friendly and relaxed. Full bar with an experienced bartender. -Neat, modern rooms - a nice change of pace. -Rooms are large - although not billed as suites, they are much larger than the typical hotel room, including fulled size couch and chair and a counter bar/table with stools. -Comfortable bed. -Some convenient features in the rooms, including mini fridge and swiveling flat-screen TV (easily viewed from bed or living area) -Decent view and easy access to the Galleria mall. Now, for the down side: -Self parking is pretty expensive for what you get; small, barely secured, uncovered lot. There's no good place to leave the car when checking in, and the valet staff seemed disorganized and unprofessional. -Staff at the desk seemed pretty indifferent about their jobs. It wasn't a warm or friendly welcome. -The walls were extremely thin, creating noise problems even in our 10th floor, exterior room. Drunken patrons tromped up and down the hall ALL NIGHT and we heard every hoot, holler, shriek and giggle like they were in the room. Truly terrible night's sleep as a result. -Furnishings and features were just too cheap to meet expectations for a 4-star hotel. Towels were large but cheap and thin. In-room coffee was very low quality and stale. Tables were made of painted plywood . No glassware provided - just a couple of dinky plastic cups. -Bathroom needed a good cleaning. There was ground-in dirt in the high traffic areas of the floor and in the textured tub. The location is good, as is the first impression of the hotel. Don't think we'll be back, though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: Timmius
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Le Meridien for three nights. It was a very nice stay. The lobby is a 12 story atrium with an ok bar. Modern and nicely furnished rooms. Pleasant staff. Great location thats across the street from the Galleria, close to a few good restaurants and good shopping.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at a SPG hotel again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Supersimp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 9 nights. It's location is excellent, the galleria mall is a stone's throw away. The only other positive is that the rooms are large in size. We are SPG members and frequently stay in SPG hotels but after this experience we will tear up our memberships. The hygiene in the hotel was poor. There were bad BO odours in many areas including the elevators at all times. Our room was large and pleasant in cheap modern decor but it had not been thoroughly cleaned in months. You could easily see a thick layer of dust on the carpets, particularly along the edges of the room. On complaining to the duty manager he viewed the dirt and organised his cleaning supervisor to clean the room herself which in all fairness she did beautifully. During our long stay here we requested for the same supervisor to clean our room several times. The main cleaning staff appear over worked and barely manage a superficial wipe down of the surfaces. The hotel should make standards of hygiene a priority. Secondly they should make customer service a priority. The staff were polite and friendly but really average. This hotel is a glorified economy travel lodge. Not what you would expect for SPG in the States.

Reviews.Title: “family/business combo trip”
Reviews.Author: thefamilythattravels
Reviews.Content: rooms were very nice, hotel was clean and upscale, breakfast was good. Negative, onsite parking was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “What a great old hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dcitgriffin
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very classy and staff was terrific! The view of downtown was great to wake up to and it was conveniently located within walking distance of several nice restaurants. The train goes right by this hotel so it makes getting around downtown Dallas very easy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kraka_Laka_169
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel & wonderful people around. From the front desk Eli@FrontDesk to morning breakfast!! From Gym to Jacuzzi, everything is pretty good. Looking forward to more stay at here.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke and Mirrors”
Reviews.Author: MLUSA
Reviews.Content: I stay over a hundred nights in hotels . This hotel simply put has the dirtiest bathrooms that I have seen in a while. The dirt is old and did not just happen. The rooms have dark grey rugs ..... Imagine how dirty they really are?.... They don't know how to clean. Great location with many other choices. Nice lobby but what lurks in the rooms is economy at best. The parking for valet is $ 24.00 per night. Next time I will make sure to keep on driving past this hotel oops sorry ...This Motel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, if you want to splurge!”
Reviews.Author: Grayanotoxin
Reviews.Content: I love the decor in this hotel; it's modern without the "cold" feel. We were in the area to visit family and the Galleria, so the location of Le Meridien is perfect! The rooms are spacious and very photogenic, and I particularly liked the glass elevators and the faint underwater bubbling sound they were playing inside. Now, the cons. It's no shock to anyone that this is a pricey stay, but I hate that you end up paying more than just the expensive nightly rate. Expect to add parking fees, and if you'd like breakfast, most items are in the $10-$15 range. The bed was comfortable, but the couches as chairs are NOT. They're definitely more for show. I was happy to see a robe in the bathroom, but it was stiff and itchy. Overall, I had a pleasant stay. It's nice to splurge occasionally!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bryan B
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Le Meridien in Dallas. The room was a very good size given the price that I paid for it, it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The pool and Jacuzzi were perfect temperatures and relaxing as well. It is right by a very nice mall. Given the price of this hotel along with the quality of the rooms I am surprised that this hotel is not in the top 20 recommendations in Dallas on here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking but had issues - modern with hard edges and big rooms-everyone friendly”
Reviews.Author: BotRoad
Reviews.Content: Our first room was nice sized but lots of hard edges from modern furniture for our kids; after checking in and going to our room, there was a horrific smell wafting from the hallway for which there was no explanation-moved to another room-arrived late the first night and in the middle of the night noticed a 2 inch yellow stain in the middle of our bed that was not washed in -yuck!!! They chgd our sheets and offered to take care if our parking ( which is pricey for Dallas at 18 for self. When we checked out after staying 2 nights the bill still showed parking. When I spoke w/front desk about entire situation, all she c/do was give me 4500 points for the entire situation!!!! Parking card didn't work and overall while everyone tried to help they didn't seem able to help effectively. Bedroom was tight sized compared to large living room. Also a bit dark overall in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the meriden”
Reviews.Author: JamesFann
Reviews.Content: I like this area of Dallas and it was very useful for our travels. We were on the 8th floor on the inside, and the bed and room were spacious and comfortable. I'd be weary of a lower level inside room though as it could get noisy depending what's going on downstairs. Nice staff, who was helpful, but the cost of the parking considering the area is pretty absurd, but I've yet to find a good hotel with reasonable parking. But outside unsecured parking for $18 is pretty silly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious, interesting, and friendly. Love it!”
Reviews.Author: RobNichols
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. It has a modern atmosphere. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, with an interesting layout that includes a seating area. The bed was comfortable; certainly a critical point for any hotel. On the tech front it offers a swivel mount flat screen TV with easily accessible ports, an iPod/iPhone dock alarm clock, and free in-room wifi. The front desk staff was pleasant, and helped us several times during our stay. (Thanks, Jenna!) We will certainly be back next time we're in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room size and decor”
Reviews.Author: mark_denton
Reviews.Content: There are things that you could pick on about this hotel. The location, while right across the street from the Galleria, is not particularly scenic, surrounded by large vacant lots and surface parking. And the service was a little rough around the edges at times, although very friendly. The size and decor of the rooms more than make up for these minor shortcomings however, especially for the price. The rooms are huge, and ours (on one of the upper SPG floors) had one of the highest ceilings I have ever seen in a hotel room. The interior design is clean and modern, without being minimal or cold. The iPod dock and auxiliary inputs for the TV were a nice touch, and the bar-height table and stools would be a perfect place to get some work done. Great value overall, and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Great price!”
Reviews.Author: thecrazylizard
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property 3 times and will stay again. It is across the street from the Galleria Mall and a couple of blocks from Valley View Mall. I love the atmosphere and modern decor. I Love: the room layout, decor, spacious rooms, flat screen tv that pulls out from the wall and swivels, ipod dock, elevators move fast. I also love the price! can't beat it. Be aware of additional parking fees for self parking and valet. If you use valet parking, be sure and tell them not to park your car under a tree! The birds will make a horrible mess!! Don't stay in room 510. its next to the "associate lounge" so people are going in and out of there all night.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific place to stay”
Reviews.Author: judydani
Reviews.Content: My husband and I randomly booked this hotel for a weekend stay in Dallas. Were we ever surprised!! The food is supurb, and we are both foodies. My husband had the best martini he has ever had; my caesar salad was the best I've ever eaten. The staff is above and beyond helpful, knowledgeable, and welcoming. The rooms are funky -- retro and fun with lots of space and storage, along with free Wifi, refrigerators, and huge plasma TV's. The beds are wonderfully comfortable. The Galleria and other shops are well within walking distance -- Macy's is right across the street. I love this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennijam
Reviews.Content: Some times things just go perfectly....and this time they DID, starting w this hotel. Adore everything about this hotel. Staff, service, decor, rooms, price, etc. etc. I cannot put any of these first. Keith (bellman) got us a driver w and SUV, which we used all wknd. Same price as a taxi. (of course we overpaid him). Walk to Galleria in 2 min. I can't say enough positive about this hotel and I can't wait to come back. It was our anniversary & your hotel made our trip special!! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Racquel P
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Dallas/NOLA. I stayed at the Le Meridien mainly because of the location so I can go shopping the day after Thanksgiving. I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked the hotel. It was a really good value for the price. Location was awesome. You can pretty much go anywhere in Dallas from this hotel within 15 minutes (if without traffic). I loved that they had private floors for Starwood Preferred Guest members. Our room was huge. Bed was super comfy. Wifi was free. Parkingwas $18/night but I live in San Francisco so that's reasonable for us. Lobby restaurant was pretty good too. All in all, this hotel I definitely recommend. Would love to stay here again when I go back to Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, hate the parking”
Reviews.Author: Emily H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and service is fantastic. Front desk and waitstaff in the bar were both as nice as could be. My only complaint was the mandatory valet parking for $25/night - if I had known that I'd have parked elsewhere because that is outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: EllePei
Reviews.Content: I don't know if this review really counts because i have stayed here every week for almost 6 months, however, i will continue. this is a very nice hotel right next to the galleria, so you're close to shopping and great eats. the hotel is trendy, but not like "aLoft" trendy, it still feels like a home away from home. they treat their platinum guests very well and they have some great food at their restaurant. breakfast is free for plats! only downside is the valet parking/self park issue. valet is $24/night and self park is $18. If you're traveling for business you won't feel the costs, but if it's for pleasure this can really affect the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for shopaholics!”
Reviews.Author: PinkPearl2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Thanksgiving holiday and found it to be a very nice property. The location is great - you can walk across the street to the Galleria mall which is great on Black Friday - no parking hassles! Only drawbacks were a limited menu at the restaurant and very poor telelvision reception on our room which faced the lobby. Relatives room on the street side had no problems. Staff are very nice, self parking is convenient, and the rooms are very modern and comfortable. Great bed and robes are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful experience there”
Reviews.Author: Michdude
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on 11/23/11 using my SPG and had a beautiful room on the 10th floor. The manager who greeted me when I arrived was courteous and helpful as was everyone else I dealt with. I love the lobby and layout of this place and the room was perfect for a techie like me. The exercise facility is very good, but I didn't use the pool so no comment on that but others were using it and looked like they were having a blast. Parking was convenient although I hate paying for these things. If I have any complains it's the shower which is old and not as pretty or modern as hotels like this usually have but it was more than adequate and did the trick. highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Uggghhhhh!”
Reviews.Author: Robertito68
Reviews.Content: My worst stay at this hotel. I stay there about every 6-8 weeks, always in a suite. I have asked repeatedly not to be given room 225. So when I showed up this time what room did I get â€“ 225. Any other similar room was â€œnot available.â€� The refriferator was not working. After crawling around on the floor in a poorly lit room I figured out it was unplugged. I plugged the power in â€“ still did not work. Engineering brought a new one and said he didnâ€™t know why the other unit was there â€“ they were â€œno good.â€� Next I went for ice. The ice machines on the second floor, the third floor, and the fourth floor were all out of order. There were big holes in the closet wall as if someone had ripped the safe off the wall and no one had repaired the damage.. I hate to leave on a sour note, so I must note that, while Sr. mgmt was unreachable, the front line staff was and always is friendly and courteous. All in all, it was a distressing visit, and probably my last one. Even though Le Meridien is closer to my business and somewhat less expensive, it is back to the InterContinental for me!

Reviews.Title: “Unique, but Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adamsaintlouis
Reviews.Content: The Le Meridien was a very unique hotel (I think that is the vibe the chain goes for) but I found the entire stay to be very pleasent. Got a room bidding on Priceline, and we felt like maybe the only guests in the hotel (it was Thanksgiving week). We stayed in a Junior Suite (thanks Priceline bidding ;) hehe) which was huge. The room also has that unique/trendy vibe, but had as very nice large flatscreen TV, huge sitting area, and nice king size bed. The bathroom was also very large. Everything was in perfect order and well-maintained. The lobby area is nice, a large open atrium. At night they light it with candles, which give it a romantic vibe. The location is easy to get to off the highway, and we walked across the street to the Galleria. Parking was expensive at $18 per night, but there were plenty of spots right by the door (again, we may have been their only guests that night....and it is a large hotel). Overall, I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: asifpunjani
Reviews.Content: this is a nice modern hotel, it has indoor pool and spa. parking was $18 for self park per day. very close to the galleria mall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JobDr
Reviews.Content: Was here on business....second trip to Dallas and this hotel. Very modern looking inside, staff is excellent.....food at the bar is good as are the drinks.....Close to shopping..plus they have a shuttle that will take you to a host of different restaurants........

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Sue M
Reviews.Content: I would like to share that I had an great experience with Ginger. She was warm, kind, professional and helpful as I interacted with her. Please be sure she is acknowledged and additonal compensation is considered. You do not want to lose an employee like Ginger, she made my stay exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Large room and good location”
Reviews.Author: GWorldTour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (7-month daughter and I) with my husband (who stays here 1/month) while he was here for business nearby. It was a very convenient location across from galleria and Starbucks a block away. We used their crib and luckily rooms are very large and can easily accommodate our family. The interior is an odd style, all rooms fave inward towards bar/lobby so we could at times hear lobby noise but really not bad. I found housekeeping to be a bit slow (left room at 1030a, back at 445p and not cleaned yet) but did a nice job each day. We enjoyed saltwater pool and hot tub one day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jay Q
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to tell you how this hotel is way above the rest. The staff make the difference. From Spencer at the front desk to Bryant and Brenda at the bar. Everyone makes you feel at home. I stay often at this hotel and have become part of the Le Meridien family. I can't begin to tell you how awesome the staff is. Special thanks to Jennifer the General Manager who has done a superb job of training her staff. This hotel outdoes the ranks of the 4 Seasons and the Ritz!!! The rooms are well kept and the hotel is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the name!!”
Reviews.Author: WDWfan81
Reviews.Content: This is actually a very old hotel. I did not realize until I arrived that I had stayed here a few times about 8 years ago. At that time it was a Hilton. It has also been another brand between times. They have dressed it up but what is obviously still the original tub & tile in the bathroom is still there. The first night I was there the bathroom was dirty and the a/c will not cool the room below about 74. I called the front desk as I was leaving the following morning and they said someone would work on it while I was gone. When I returned that evening the bathroom was clean, but the room would still not get cool enough to sleep. Had to shower with my feet underwater as the drain did not work well. While hearing a shower going in a nearby room the entire sink filled with sudsy water (that smelled awful) within about 1" of overflowing. It took several minutes for the water to drain. They market this as an upscale hotel, but I would have much preferred to have been at the Courtyard and would have saved some $$$

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: J A
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that the hotel itself is in places a little "worn" - i.e. scrapes, etc. and some of the rooms aren't in tip top shape. But, what I really love about this place is that the employees are great. The folks driving the shuttle van if you use it (complimentary within a couple miles of the hotel) are fantastic, and you don't get the attitude you get with taxi drivers. The front desk is always awesome and treats you like they actually are glad you are there. In fact on one trip they missed putting in my green room points, I contacted the customer service and they just immediately took my word for it. Other hotels would have fought tooth and nail, tried to make me prove it, etc. And every night some wonderful lady comes by the rooms with a free little dessert!!! So - overall for the price, and great staff, I've continued to stay there on my every month trips to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Barbara the Bartender!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gina_FromDC
Reviews.Content: Besides the fact that the LeMeridien is a really nice hotel and that I would definitely stay here again, Barbara the Bartender is absolutely WONDERFUL!!! Her friendly personality, great conversation and the wonderful drinks she made kept my friends and I coming back. I had wonderful time in Dallas and Barabara definitely helped make that happen. The next time you visit this hotel, please be sure to ask for Barbara and tell her that Gina, Pam, and Peaches from DC sent you!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “The Best Bartendar in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Peaches1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Meridien Galleria as part of a group that flew down to Dallas for the Washington v. Dallas game. The tour promoter could not have chosen a better hotel. From arrival to departure the service was expectational. However, Barbara, the lobby bar bartender was fabulous. She had a very personal touch and warm demeanor that made you fill at home. She made my stay at Le Meridien wonderful. Because of Barbara I will definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to all my friends. Thanks Le Meridien and Barbara!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for a girl's trip!”
Reviews.Author: NPearce
Reviews.Content: After looking for a nice hotel for a girl's weekend, I stumbled upon Le Meridien. For the price, I was very impressed. Our suite was very spacious and had plenty of room for all of us to be comfortable. The beds were extremely comfortable. The location of the hotel is great for shopping at The Galleria, but it is a little drive to downtown. However, it was in a nice area and we felt safe at all hours. The service was just okay. Nothing spectacular, but not terrible. The atmosphere definitely caters to women (pink, black and white- feminine decor). It's modern and has a sexy vibe. We enjoyed the look of the hotel, the location and comfort. Overall, it was a nice weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect for the price.”
Reviews.Author: portochulizco
Reviews.Content: WE decided to stay at Le Meridien GAlleria because the proximity to the mall but not attached to it which would have cost much more. Rooms are extremely spacious and very clean and well decorated and appointed. The only reason why I did not give it 5 stars is because some of the services I always expect from this chain like spa were absent. None the less, if you are staying at this property it's because you are in Dallas to shop and therefore out of the hotel most of the day anyway. If I return to Dallas this is where I want to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time on game weekend”
Reviews.Author: NateBurk
Reviews.Content: My crew spent a Friday night there, and the hotel is amazing. Great looks, helpful staff, and the rooms were quite impressive. Sarah Conger at the front desk was awesome! She helped us out of a serious bind. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Diane M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at Le Meridien and were pleasantly pleased. From Harold who worked the front desk to our waiter for dinner. The dinner was also wonderful. We had the ribeye steak and it was cooked to perfection!! The service was impeccable. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and this was our first time at Le Meridien but will definitly not be our last. I read the other reviews previously and was a little weary of the hotel. However this was not the case. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: harrietfly
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday weekend and upon arrival there was a very nice tray of sweets and a welcome card from the manager. Aside from the awesome sweets and cheeses the first night, this is an awesome location. The rooms are well appointed and very fashionable, I got some great decorating tips for home ;). The plasma was on a swing arm so you could watch TV in bed or in the sitting area. The room had all the hookups for your iPods, DVD, etc. Lots of outlets which is often overlooked. The bed was incredibly heavenly and about as comfortable as you could get. The Galleria is a very short walk which I wish I could have stayed longer! Lots and lots of awesome stores. WOW. When we return to Dallas, we will be sure to return for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! The pictures don't even do it justice. The room and bathroom were enormous and so well decorated, and the bed was very plush and comfy. The lobby has a hip lounge feel with very unique furniture. We didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurant but the menu looked amazing (though a little pricey). The glass enterior elevator was a neat touch and they assigned us a room at top which my 4 year old loved. Great views! The pools was nice but the chlorine smell was a little overwhelming (the pool is indoors.) Besides that this hotel was one of my favorites and we will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “The only awkward part was the hooker in the elevator”
Reviews.Author: apolkadot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-suited to shoppers, as it is right across from the Galleria mall. The parking lot was well lit, athough pricey at $18/night for park-it-yourself ($24 for valet), but I felt like my car would be safe here. The lobby was nice and the staff generally helpful. We asked for a room on the top floor (10th) and it was clean and quiet. Very large for the price. As others have stated, rooms have a modern decor that is well-appointed. It had a fridge, but it is a mini bar fridge that didn't get cold at all. I think they allow pets, because I heard a little yappy dog through the wall in the morning. If not, someone did a good job smuggling in a dog. You have to use your hotel key inside the elevator to get to the floors, which is a nice feature. The only awkward experience was the man meeting the (obvious) hooker in the elevator. She looked like a classy hooker at least... but yeah, still a hooker in a nice hotel. I know that kind of stuff happens at hotels, but I'd rather not be anywhere near it.

Reviews.Title: “It's our home away from home !”
Reviews.Author: sassyme1788
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the decor and comfort that Le Meridien has to offer. Its very modern and easy on the eyes. I live about an hour away and often come here to relax and enjoy short staycations! I have also fallen in love with the absolutely fabulous martinis that your awesome mixologist/bartender/navigator Bryant makes. He is always very friendly and quick to jump on my indecisiveness as far as what I want to eat or drink. He is also very informative to me as well as other guests on cool places to go visit in the area. Overall this hotel is a wonderful experience and far better than its competition such as the dreaded hilton across the road. Bryant as well as other staff members make each experience enjoyable !

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Randy G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the better part of two weeks in April and think this is an undervalued hotel. It doesn't cost that much, but the rooms are quite large, comfortable and well-kept. It's not as fancy as the Westin Galleria across the street, but it also costs a lot less too. As a Starwood Platinum member, I'm not sure whether I was upgraded to a suite or not (they never said) but the rooms I received were in line with actual suites at many other hotels I've stayed at, so it frankly reflects well on the hotel if I wasn't actually given an upgrade. No other benefits for Platinum folks though. Room service was fast and tasty enough (as far as room service goes), but you can always walk to the Galleria to get a lot more dining options. The hotel only offers valet parking, which is an unnecessary $20/day charge, but the valets are pretty efficient and when I lost my ticket, they helped me find my car without making a big deal about it. I would definitely stay here again (but I must admit, if someone else is paying for it, I would opt for the nicer Westin Galleria).

Reviews.Title: “You will be pleasantly surprised from the moment you walk in the door!”
Reviews.Author: RuthAStoddard
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful boutique hotel in a great location and a great price. The staff was gracious and we were well taken care of. Upgrade to a suite and you will enjoy the space and the amenities. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: rd1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for Valentine's Day this year. The first night we stayed in a Jr Suite which was very big. The decor was very modern which I liked! The bad thing about this night was that apparently the hotel had been robbed in the middle of the night and police officers went door to door banging on everyone's door in the middle of the night which scared us like crazy. It's was around 2-3am and being awoken by a banging on your door can really rattle you. I expected at least an apology from the front desk in the morning or something to say sorry for the awful night but no one even mentioned it, it was as if nothing happened. I know it wasn't their fault they were robbed but it did happen in their hotel so I just thought they'd want to assure their guest that this never has happened before and we're so sorry but didn't get anything out of them. The staff was nice enough but not at all what I would call warm and friendly. Did do a very good job at giving off a welcoming feeling. The second night we stay in an actual suite. It was a very nice room however it smelled like cigerette smoke badly (in this non smoking room). I called down to the front desk to let them know and was told house keeping would be up with an air purifier but they never came. We eventually left to start our day and didn't complain any further when we returned. The hotel itself is nice... I'd say a 3 star but with the staff I would take it down to maybe a 2-2.5 star. I would stay again if I need a room in the area but to plan another trip to stay the specifically, not going to happen!

Reviews.Title: “So-so.”
Reviews.Author: vlooney53
Reviews.Content: Well you get what you pay for and we had booked a special rate for one night with Hotwire.com. The hotel was pretty and in a good location close to highways for travelers, but it smelled funky seemingly due to poor air circulation. When we were shown to our room the smell was even worse--kinda musty with an acrid, smokey scent. I called and had us switched to another room on a different floor only to find it was the same. Gross. It was quiet though, and the decor was different, more modern. I just couldn't get over the smell. The service was ok--no free parking though, and there never seemed to be enough staff on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful decor and great bed with plenty of space in the room!”
Reviews.Author: SVRK
Reviews.Content: Positives: Decor was very modern. The bed was one of the best ones that I've had in recent memory. Room had a lot of space to move around with plenty of seating areas (huge plus). Very efficient layout for relaxing while watching tv or sitting at table to eat or sleeping. Rate was very reasonable considering the area. $125/nt. Negatives: Not much of a staff present. Valet was not really worth it since self parking is right in front of the entrance. If hotel is busy then definitely use valet. Neutrals: SPG level did not seem to have any additional amenities that I could tell but at least it is more private since you would need room card to get on the 10th and 11th levels. Cards left by housekeeping were for the previous guest.

Reviews.Title: “Very original hotel, worth staying in”
Reviews.Author: Sacra13
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 days. I picked it due to a convenient location, original spacious rooms and price balance. The room is like a mini apartment, very open, nice, has a living room area, bar-counter kind of area, the sleeping area and of course a restroom - which you can approach through two different doors. It is definitely a good value/price ratio. The inside of the hotel is open, so you can see almost all doors of other rooms of the hotel from wherever you are. Staff is very nice and polite. The fridge that is in the room is actually just a mini cooler, not really a fridge, so they brought me an actual mini fridge because of that. The room was clean, the cleaning lady did not pick up her tip for some reason, so I stopped leaving them :) However, they do not change sheets! Before the last night I stayed there, I actually went to the front desk and asked my sheets to be changed. Other hotels do it every day or every other day, here they do not do it. The swimming pool area is not very nice, and the pool is small. The clock on the wall was broken all days there, until I pointed it out to the pool keeper. The restaurant at the hotel - eh... I tried going there for breakfast once, but it seemed to be chaotic, I was not sure if it is a buffet or order type, and there was no information at the front desk about it. This hotel is one of very few I have been to where they do not have information about the hotel channel on TV, even though TV was really good. No nice views through the window - just buildings and empty dirt lots... The hotel is quite new though. The nice part about it - you can walk to the Galleria Mall, which is a huge plus for two reasons. You can park there in the mall's garage- a huge minus for the hotel - they charge you for parking, 24 dollars a day (in Texas??? really??? I did not have to pay for hotel parking in San Francisco!). Another huge plus of the mall being so near - that's like the only thing there is to do in Dallas. The most boring city I have been to. The food though is really good there. I checked out Eatzi's, a very old BBQ place close to the university, and some other places - the food is really good there.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't choose this hotel again!!!”
Reviews.Author: jacobbroberts
Reviews.Content: The hotel and ammenities were decent but there were a few things that made this hotel very unlikeable. The hotel was extremely understaffed having only one person to check people in and having only one valet. Maybe they are merely accepting of the fact that people don't visit this hotel. Secondly, what little staff they had was extremely unfriendly. I was basically asked what I needed when I went to the front desk and was handed the key to my room. The third thing that irritated me was the fact that you had to pay $20 to park your own car maybe 50 feet from the entrance of the hotel. I am used to paying to park but $20 is extremely unreasonable. (TIP: If you ignore my review and just really want to stay at this hotel. Park your vehicle across the street at the Galleria. It's free!!! Tell the front desk you arrived in a cab.) Lastly, we heard strange sounds in the middle of the night coming from our restroom. We woke up the next morning to a sink filled with unimaginable substances. I was going to take a picture and post it on here but I feel as if that would be too much. Unfortunately, this hotel could be really nice because the facilities are nice and the rooms are large with most having some sort of view. I wouldn't stay here again though. Not until I can be assured they have made some changes to their business model. One more thing. Don't be the first person in the pool/hot tub in the morning. I don't know what time they get cleaned but it isn't before 10:00 a.m. We saw some strange things floating in both.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected "self-park" charge - if you don't know it yet”
Reviews.Author: minerval
Reviews.Content: I got the deal through priceline.com to blindly "get a hotel room" for a night and I got Le Meridien Dallas By The Galleria. While I was vaguely recalled seeing it being built, it indeed is a nice-looking, very modern and quite clean high-end hotel. However, this is the first time ever I stayed in any hotel in the world, that charge us a "self-park" fee, $18 + tax per 24 hours during your stay. This "self-park" charge is totally uncalled for. I was too tired and shocked to argue, then I will try to avoid this place if I can, or I will bid very low next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mskeri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I rented a room at the Le Meridien for our anniversary. We wanted a quiet night away from kids, so had requested a high room far from elevators. We were given exactly that in a corner room away from the atrium noise. This is not one of Starwood's luxury hotels. It appears to be a budget hotel with some pizazz in the form of decor. It's a fun atmosphere, and the room sizes would be great for families traveling. Having read some of the Tripadvisor reviews, I was prepared for the parking fees. We chose a deal that included parking and breakfast for two for only $25 more than the room price, so we essentially ate breakfast for $5. And the breakfast was amazing â€” a buffet that included oatmeal with all the fixins, breads and jams (even salmon for bagels), an omelet bar, a waffle bar, bacon and eggs, and â€” my favorite â€” Illy coffee. (Juice, too.) I don't know what the regular price is, but $2.50 per person seemed more than reasonable to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design, great staff, one or two functional drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: NigelMA
Reviews.Content: This is an airy hotel with a focus on design over comfort. I stayed in one of the outside suites (x20) which has more space than many rooms. The room itself was very relaxing, a good sofa area and large flat screen TV (I personally hardly ever switch it on). The bedroom was open and airy - the bed up to SPGs high standards was very comfortable and easy to sleep in. For a change, the AC actually cooled the room so this was a big plus. The bathroom was spacious. The staff were all very helpful and super-friendly. I arrived around 1.45pm and had to wait till 3pm for my room (which was upgraded as I'm SPG Platinum so that was a big plus - thanks). Waiting was comfortable in the lobby and it gave me a chance to grab some lunch. I only had a couple of gripes: My big concern (and I expressed this to the staff at the welcome reception) was the comfort at the desk for working - I had a couple of hours work to do at my computer and after sitting in the high stool for 40 minutes I had to leave the desk - it's simply too uncomfortable to work. Unfortunately the sofa wasn't conducive to working either - so if you plan on working in your room, and assuming all rooms are the same, you may want to consider the Westin on the other side of the Galleria. Personally I like the style of this hotel over the Westin but those desk stools are seriously uncomfortable since the front rises up and digs into your legs. The assistant sales director said nobody had ever complained ... which amazes me. (My recommendation would be to have ergonomic chairs that are comfortable to work in over designer wire stools that look chic). The location next to the Galleria provides plenty of choice for shopping and food. Another reason I booked this hotel is it has an indoor pool - unfortunately it was closed due to maintenance when I was there. My other gripe was the electric outlets next to the bed (though this hotel is better than some) - at least this hotel has a single outlet available on the left side of the bed (opposite side to the clock radio) - surely hotel designers realize people need bedside outlets! And the clock radio has no "sleep" function - so while it can charge my iPod and play tracks from it, if I just want to listen to the radio and have it shutoff automatically ... well fortunately I have an app for that on my iPad - wifi was mostly good - though other reviews suggest otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: txninja
Reviews.Content: We got a steal on our rooms at this hotel, and I'm glad that we had the chance to experience it. The modern look was great and easy on the eyes. The location is directly across the street from the Galeria with the Valley Mall less than a mile away which makes this hotel a great place to stay for shop-aholics. The staff was courteous and accommodating. The rooms were larger than expected and well kept. The only complaint was that the pool (located on the lower level) seemed small and was constantly over-run with children.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice! Modern but comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: marygreene
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. I would highly recommend, especially for business travelers since check in, check out and food service was fast. You can walk across the street to the Galleria too, which is convenient. Parking is onsite and is $18/day, and I don't think there are other options around so be aware, I did hear a few people upset about that since we're not really in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reuben32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went up for a long weekend (5 days) to old friends in Dallas. We have stayed in a number of hotels in the Dallas area over the years (Westin, Crowne Plaza, Hampton, Hyatt, Hilton, Adam's Mark, Sheraton). By far the Westin Galleria is one of our favorites. But we saw a good deal at a "4 star" hotel at Le Meridien so we thought we would take a chance. We knew about the $20 a day parking policy before we got there so it wasn't a shock to us. I think the parking was excessive, most valet's I've used before are 5, 10, or 15. When we got there I was relatively impressed. The first valet, Kenny, took the stuff up to our room and was very helpful. He got in and out of the room so fast I had to track him down to give him his tip. The other valet's, on the other hand, were horrible. They were slow, and inattentive...I was not as generous in my tipping as I usually am with valet's because (at $20 the tip should be included) and the service sucked. The room was a poor attempt at being chic, but failed miserably. The room was all white with accents of black...it was a bad attempt at french decor. You could tell, by the white paint how dinged and worn everything was. A word of advice to the hotel, using soft or colored lights would go a LONG way in making everything look better. The pool was just about the same, poorly kept. One person who came down to swim accidentally pulled the railing out of the concrete twice, getting in and out of the pool (talk about poor workmanship.) Housekeeping only came 3 out of the 5 days we were there, and we had to ask for it almost everyday. They came one day at 3pm, one day after 5pm, and one day we had to ask the front desk to send them when we left for dinner at 7pm because they had not come yet. The first time they did a poor job (put dirty towels back on the rack and barely made the bed.) The second time they did a little better but not much. The last day was the only time they vacuumed and actually did a decent job cleaning up the place. On the morning we left I called the front desk and asked them to send someone up to help with our luggage. We waited over half an hour and no one came. I walked down to the valet to ask for help, they clearly had not been notified. I tipped one man $5 to help us, he came to the room with the cart, but I had to put all the luggage on the cart myself, and when we got to the car I had to load the trunk myself. (What did I just tip for?) I know this is going to come across as a snobby review, but for a hotel that claims it is 4 stars, I expected MUCH better. Save yourself the trouble, stay at the Westin next door, they know how to treat their guests. If the hotel listed itself as a 3 or a 3.5 star, perhaps it would warrant a more favorable review.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Friendly HORRIBLE PARKING POLICY....”
Reviews.Author: SHSU_Bearkat
Reviews.Content: To make this review quick and simple, I enjoyed the staff and rooms, but the parking was horrible. They make you valet your car for 20 dollars a night, and god forbid if youre in a hurry because you will have to wait for your car, as opposed to if they had sometype of free or five dollar parking. Their valet works hard, its just bad policy by Le Meridien.... The rooms are cool and big, but honestly I would rather deal with a nicer Holiday Inn Express. This hotel needs tremendous work on their parking policy or at least have free parking for their local guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: txoxo87
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to stay here after seeing it's website and pictures. And was immediately let down when I got there. Once I arrived for check-in, my room was not even ready. I was upset at first but then was settled when they offered a compensation for my having to wait much longer than expected. AWESOME! Le Meridien really does care about their customers. This place is very pretty and very modern. The pool is extremely small and I did not get to enjoy it. Really that's the only flaw I have to mention other than the room situation. But other than that, Spencer at the front desk was wonderful! Taylor the valet was great! Josh from Palette was super! I would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “STAYING IN STYLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: abridg77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Meridien on one of our weekend shopping trips and the hotel stay was wonderful!!! It is in a great location, right across the road from the galleria mall and we were able to just walk over and shop. The decor was beautiful and very up to date. We will stay here again on our shopping weekends. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: atxtravelinman
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel mid week while on business and things were pretty low key. I really enjoyed the room, however. The beds weren't the most comfortable in the world, but they did the trick. I would stay here again for my next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A good 4 star hotel - in spite of the $20 parking”
Reviews.Author: davidmf
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times with my Son for a â€œBoys Night Outâ€� â€“ or give Mom a Break â€“ as I travel a lot for work., so we come here to have fun, relax, play at the pool, order room service, watch movies and doing something around the area. I normally get a great rate via Hotwire, so that make things even better. The Hotel is very contemporary, both in the rooms and public areas, with almost everything based around the Atrium â€“ including the lounge and restaurant. Although it is right by the Galleria it is not easy or obvious to get to, unless you know the local area, you might want to check or ahead for directions otherwise. Since there is a Westin Hotel on the Galleria itself, I wonder if was built as an â€œoverflowâ€� from that, especially since they are both Starwood Brands. We are always made to feel very welcome by all the staff, although since these are stays are short - itâ€™s fair to say we donâ€™t have too much interaction. The Rooms themselves are very generously sized - pretty much a junior suite â€“ I like the layout with the TV in the middle - along with the multimedia connections so you can lay out on the sofa, or watch from the bed, or generally just hang out and The only room negative is the fridge, they are using a peltier fridge â€“ not a proper one, which is really designed to keep cool things cool. Free Internet as well, which is always good! I have stayed here more than once since December 2009, and I have not seen any wear and tear described by others, maybe I have just been lucky. We had room service the last time, I like the special they have here, where if you spend $15 you can order a movie for free The Pool in the basement, while not huge, is not a bad size and the whole area is well maintained, almost a mini oasis in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. The major negative for me is hotel parking, as others have mentioned the only option is valet and $20 a night, which is ridiculous for the area, especially since the Galleria is next door and free! In fact that is what we did on our last stay, our car was 2 mins away from the front door, not exactly inconvenient. Overall a solid 4 Star Hotel, if business or pleasure brings you to this part of Dallas, or if you are local and want a quick getaway - you canâ€™t go far wrong coming here.

Reviews.Title: “I think I have the answer to these widely varied reviews...”
Reviews.Author: kjhMN
Reviews.Content: If you arrive in the daytime, the white walls show their wear, the decor is a little harsh, and the trendy vibe seems a bit too IKEA. I checked in late afternoon, sun streaming in and the room looked dingy, every defect showed. But like most things, when you hit evening and dim down the lights, it's much prettier. So when I returned later that night, the turn-down service had left me a dessert treat, turned on ambient lighting, and the room was actually quite beautiful. Note - housekeeping is lacking as of June 2011, bathroom floor was very unclean, I will spare you the detail, but they did come in and clean it for me. The coffee maker had used coffee pods in the water reservoir which was gross, but again, front desk came through and delivered a small pot of coffee prior to my 6AM call, which was a fine solution. In summary - trendy decor like a Zen inspired IKEA concept, responsive staff, generous room size, very nice towels, firm but comfy bed, small saltwater pool in the basement, decent size workout room. The downside: inadequate housekeeping, hefty fee for valet parking (required, no free or self park). For the money, I'd pick the Westin next door as a first choice for overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive meal at Palette Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: gigi_aldrete
Reviews.Content: We live in Dallas and dined at their restaurant for the first time. Our initial impression upon arrival was disappointment because the parking is valet only and we prefer to park ourselves. Upon entering the hotel, we discovered the restaurant was the lobby bar which was not the ambience we were hoping for and after standing around for a few minutes feeling ignored, we realized it was a seat-yourself venue. However, the place is very elegantly appointed and we did not experience any disturbing noise factor as can typically occur in a lobby or bar area. Once seated, the disappointment ceased. Our waitress was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and anything else about the hotel we were interested in. Everything we ordered was well prepared and very tasty. The fried calamari was perfectly cooked and served with an Asian type of sauce -- very unique and a delightful surprise. The pork tenderloin medallions were melt-in-your-mouth and included a light sauce that added another dimension of flavor without smothering the pork. The flank steak special was also perfectly cooked and tender. For dessert, the chocolate molton cake was recommended and we also tried their version of strawberry shortcake using a lemon poundcake. I love chocolate but this shortcake version was my favorite. I would be remiss to leave out the lemon drop martini perfectly prepared by the bartender with fresh-squeezed lemon juice and sugar rim. We'll be back and hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “This Property is Quickly Declining”
Reviews.Author: jeamon
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here with my husband in November 2010, relatively shortly after it opened. We loved it! The rooms were clean and spacious, the staff was courteous, and the location was good, too. We've stayed here three times since then, the most recent ending today. Last time we noticed that some maintenance needed to be done - the walls and ceilings showed wear, doors were smudgy, things like that. Well, this time, our room has several places where the molding on the corners is broken off, the doors are scuffed, the bed is lumpy, the bedside tables are stained, the toilet actually rocks when you sit down, and the bathroom smells vaguely of sewage. This was a short stay and we were using reward points, so perhaps we were siphoned off to a poorer room as a result. If so, that is certainly not the way to instill loyalty in customers. Add to this the $20 mandatory valet parking and the price (even using points!) is simply not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: pinksparkles32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Meridien for my husband's birthday weekend and loved it! The service was wonderful and Barbara, the bartender, was knowledgeable about both the area and Dallas in general. And she makes a mean espresso martini! Definitely recommend Le Meridien!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: traveler1995
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service in a beautiful hotel! Can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need Update and Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: mocha2005
Reviews.Content: Room's A/C was not accurate, refrigerator had warning that it was not appropriate for keeping food from spoiling (apparently just a "mini-bar" refrigerator, with no drinks), soap dish broken, lamp broken, bed was hard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Modern, but Not As High-Quality After the 1st Impression Wears Off”
Reviews.Author: ebisuroppongi
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Starwood Points member, and recently reached Platinum - I stayed here about 15 nights in the past 2 months for business. My first few stays were nice. Overall, this is a pretty good option in the area. Modern hotel with modern furnishings, good TV in the room, nice lobby, good indoor pool. However, the WESTIN GALLERIA is a much better option, and depending on your corporate rate, they are the same cost, since Le Meridien charges you for parking. Here are my main complaints: Consistency of service: As a loyal Platinum level customer, I expect to be treated consistently well each time. However, service here is very inconsistent. Depending on who checks me in, I will either get placed on the top floor, or I will get placed on a lower floor. The top 2 floors are reserved for Starwood Elite members. They give you a robe, free water in the rooms, candy... However, there have been times when I get these amenities in the lower rooms, and times when the upper rooms do not have them. For instance, I just had to call for water and a robe and I'm on the 5th floor. Build Quality: I noticed that although the rooms have nice-looking mod furnishings, they are not of high quality. The table lamp for example, had the shade part just fall off as I was adjusting it. The toilet paper holder has fallen off the wall on 3 different occasions in 3 different rooms. Amenities: There is no kitchen here, I am not sure why one of the people posted this. They give you an empty fridge, that's it. The gym is rather smallish, and not enough free-weights. The Marriott, Westin, Intercontinental in this area have much better gyms. Parking based on my corporate rate is $10.00 a day. I am not sure why they charge you valet in this area. Westin does not charge for parking! Pool is nice, though it's indoor. The Westin has a nicer more resort-style outdoor pool. The Marriott on Quorum has a pool that is indoor/outdoor which is a nice option. There is no lounge for Starwood elite members - so no free happy hour. They do however offer free breakfast if you are a platinum level guest. Cleanliness: On a scale of 1-10, the room has a cleanliness average of 7 for me. I've found the random long hair here and there, and even though this hotel is only 1.5 years old, it's age is starting to show on the doors and walls (scratched up). I stay here because I'm a loyal Starwood customer and I like their points program. The overall Starwood brand has good hotel options in most cities for the frequent business traveler. However, it only serves as my back-up place when I can't get the Westin Galleria as that place tends to get overbooked. Overall the staff is pretty good. They are nice, polite, and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but not great, valet parking in this area is unnecessary!”
Reviews.Author: the_wosh
Reviews.Content: Renovated hotel - skimped on odd things like the elevator panel. Room was pretty big, a couple of sticky spots on the carpet. Location is average, behind the mall facing a parking structure and you have to make u-turns coming in from the freeway (from DFW) AND when leaving to get back on the freeway (to DFW), which can be annoying. Service was hit or miss - housekeeping staff was great, some at the front desk were less helpful than others. A few didn't care at all. No upgrades for SPG Gold members. Worst was the valet parking - not necessary in North Dallas. Free internet was a nice perk, but kept disconnecting me. Wouldn't return to this SPG property - there are better choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DivaChronicles
Reviews.Content: I visited the Dallas area to celebrate a friend's 30th birthday and we stayed at this property which I did not know was part of the SPG awards group. My friend was unable to get reservations, but when I called and gave my SPG member number, I was booked right away! I received the Government Rate and I was upgraded to a suite with free parking for an additinal 30 dollars, which was worth it! The room was nice, modernly furnished and roomy! The Hotel is located right across the street from the Galleria, so we were able to shop until we dropped and only have to cross the street to return to the Hotel! The Hotel Desk personnel were AWESOME and the Valets were very courteous! The Hotel was tastefully decorated and the bar was nice and we had appetizers which were also very tasty. This was my first time staying at this property and I will gladly stay there again on my next visit to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. mediocre breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lovetooexplore
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite frequently. Usually greeted warmly. On my last stay the hotel must have had a total breakdown in the kitchen in the morning. The breakfast buffet was disorganized, mostly out of food, and unappetizing. On typical days it is better, though I'm always amazed at the variety of what I am charged.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service !”
Reviews.Author: WallStreet_1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Starwood (SPG) property many times due to convenience (it's near my office) but this will be my last. Poor customer service, bad attitudes, dirty bathrooms, ultra loud bar area that permeates throughout the entire hotel and a $20 per night parking fee just isn't worth the 'convenience factor' anymore. I will Vote with my wallet and spend my $ where they are appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette Party-Nice”
Reviews.Author: Newton1love
Reviews.Content: My friends booked a stay at Le Meridien Dallas, and we had a great stay. The hotel was in great shape and the front desk reps were very kind. The bus boy that parks your cars and takes your luggage up, put our clothes in the storage closet and left them there. That rubbed me the wrong way, however they were great and figuring out where our lost luggage was and brought it to us within 30 -45 minutes. You pay 20.00 for parking overnight so be aware of that and 5.00 for a day. We stayed in the executive suite and the room is set up awkward. Hard to explain but the tv is in the middle of the room causing you to have to lay on the far left side of the bed in order to see it. I would suggest that they reconsider the set up of the room it just did not seem to flow. Other than that, the hotel was great, the comforters on the bed are nice and plush! Very nice for a ladies weekend ...o yeah and it was VERY clean which is VERY important to me. Will definitely visit again

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, large structure but personal service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Tschaller
Reviews.Content: One night stay, the valet park situation is bizarre and a joke - but the service is great and everyone seems to like their job at the hotel. Hotel is very nice, defintely 4 star or 4 diamond quality. Large room and most seem to view north dallas and the galleria but there are a few that apparently have a view of the huge atrium - which is unique and provides an international flavor. Music throughout the day seems to come from the Middle East and the crowd tended toward young affluent.. Food downstairs is nicely done in a busy kitchen that is viewed from an angle off the floor. The TV's at the bar seemed small and difficult to watch unless you were sitting right in front of them. I would return again. Nice property. Also internet did not work for me at the highest floor - but worked fine in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “All looks, no substance”
Reviews.Author: doghousejohnny
Reviews.Content: If you're a 55 year old man having a mid-life crisis and dating a 23 year old majoring in Life Management, this is the place for you. Looks nice, but you HAVE to valet and it is a mandatory $20 charge per night. The AC doesn't work. The staff doesn't care. Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jbennett10
Reviews.Content: My stay at Le Meridien was phenomenal. The hotel exterior, lobby and suites are beautiful and contemporary. I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “spacious room, love the empty fridge and free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: highlandbride
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of Super Bowl traveling team. Sky high rates but then every hotel in town jacked up the rates. Room was spacious with work counter, free wi-fi, empty fridge ready for my own things, and good bed. Hotel was a bit weak on the bathroom toiletries, including leading someone else's hair conditioner in the room for me to toss upon check in. Don't like the valet only parking arrangement which was a drag. Restaurant was so -so, much better to walk across the street to Galleria Mall and find a spot in the shopping center. Room service only available at limited hours - if you arrive early/late, don't expect much in terms of options.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel with unfixed room fixtures”
Reviews.Author: SC_Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Le Meridien Dallas. I usually stay at the Westin Park Central (well recommended) but it was booked. Location wise, this place is in a good spot - close to local businesses and of course the Galleria Mall. I arrived at the hotel at midnight and was annoyed that valet parking was the only option there for $20/night. So I parked across the street as other reviewers have. Decor of the hotel and my room were very hip and modern. They gave me a nice spacious room. However, I was annoyed that the remote didn't work. I called down to the front desk and engineering wasn't around at that time to replace it. Then I discovered the toilet paper holder was practically falling off the wall so it was slanted down. The soap dish rack was also broken in that wasn't fastened to the shower wall properly. Albeit minor, these things don't make for a good impression for a hotel that you'd consider more upper-tier. Their elevators have "soundscapes" - instead of literally elevator music, I heard rainfall one night and crickets last night. Loudly. Overall, for the value, it's a good place to stay. The hotel just needs to pay attention to the detail and make sure the rooms are in working order! And get rid of the valet-only option!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: iris915
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel. While traveling with my husband for a getaway weekend I was treated with great customer service at an amazing property. Not only was this hotel beautiful, it was a great experice from start to finish. I have to say the valet department was a huge pluss. To be greated upon arival with such a high level of service and professionalism made the biggest difference in our stay. There were a few guys from this department and their supervisor that really made our stay. All I can say is if your looking for a great place in Dallas that has a very high level of service. Stay at Le Meridien you wont regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend this to a friend”
Reviews.Author: LHarp122
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews of this property, I decided to take a risk and see if my luck was better than many others who stayed here. Well, as luck would have it, I had a sub-par experience at the Le Meridien Dallas. It started when we arrived around 4 p.m. There were only 2 valet working and there was a line of cars ready to check in. It took about 10 minutes to get to the front of the line. Christ was our bellman/valet and he was very friendly and prompt. When we got to the front desk, there was a line of about 5 people waiting to check-in in front of us, with only 2 hotel staff at the check-in desk. When we got to the front of the line, about 15 minutes later, we were told by Taylor that there were no clean rooms available at the moment and that we would be notified as soon as something was available, most likely in about 20 minutes. We went to the bar grabbed a drink and sat down in the lobby. After an hour had passed, I went to check on our room. I again waited in line at the check-in desk for about 20 minutes because there was only one person working the desk. When it was finally my turn, I was told that my room had been ready and someone tried to find me but couldn't so the room was given away. What? I watched the front desk the entire time we were waiting and no one even made an attempt to find us. My name was never called, no one came looking for me. Luckily, Bookie was able to call and find a room for us. Had I never gone up to the desk to check, I probably would still be sitting in that lobby. The room was nice...nothing to write home about. It just seemed like we were in a modern, 2-3 star hotel. Not a 4 star Le Meridien. Maybe I expected too much. All in all, I was disappointed. The food was eh. The service was eh. Won't go back. Wouldn't recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “This use to be our Dallas spot, but now it is not...”
Reviews.Author: 4trinap
