Reviews.Content: When I come to Dallas, I usually stay in this hotel. I love the modern dÃ©cor and trendy vibe that this hotel offers. However, I was very disappointed with my last visit at the hotel. Because of our experience with the poor customer service and the problems in our room, we will not stay here again. I just want to say my friend and I are not big complainers. We do not look for the faults in a situation. It doesnâ€™t take much to please us. However, after a variety of mishaps, it does get overwhelming. When we first got into our rooms, the door was stuck. We had difficulty opening and closing the door throughout our stay. Ok, not a big deal. We can get over this. ( Despite the fact that the door was so messed up that when we thought it was closed it actually accidentally left it open one night.. Thank God nothing was stolen) Next the lights in the bathroom did not work. It was an intermittent problem so when we called for help, the lights did work. Of course they did not work when we needed them, like in the morning when we wanted to take a shower and when we had to use the bathroom at night. Ok we got over that fine. Next our linens were not clean. They had a very strong musty smell to them. We didnâ€™t want to make a big deal out of this. We just called the front desk and asked for fresh linens. When they brought the next set of linens, they smelled worst then the first set of linens. Ok now, so are starting to get annoyed. So then we again called, told them that we did not have clean linens wanted a set of fresh linens. The guy finally came with fresh linens. While he was making up our bed, someone came over the radio ( the walkie talkie) and told said that we were going crazy! Did someone at the front desk just call us crazy for asking for clean linens?!?!?! Now mind you we were not rude, or even angry at this point. We were slightly annoyed. Next we decided to go to the bar and get some drinks. We told someone at the front desk that we were unhappy with being called crazy and he said for our inconvenience he will comp our drinks . ( 2 drinks total) now the bartender at the bar heard him say this, but when he walked away, he refused to honor this and we ended up paying for our drinks anyways! The next morning when the lights in the bathroom would not come on, we were done! So we talked to a front desk manager, told him about experience. All he offered was to waive the valet fee. ( However, he already mentioned that it wasnâ€™t even going to charge on our account). I did not think this was sufficient. I eventually talked to another manager. He offered a $40 credit. Not towards our room but towards food. We are not big drinkers and we never eat at the hotel so we did not think this was sufficient. We are regular visitors of the hotel. And I understand that things happen. But the customer service experience was one of the worst and when we visit Dallas again in a few months we are definitely trying a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A RIPOFF”
Reviews.Author: galwayghost
Reviews.Content: They charge for everything!! And don't tell you when you book a reservation. No customer service either!!1

Reviews.Title: “All Around Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AweSumThenSum
Reviews.Content: From the supremely accommodating and very knowledgeable Taylor and Mir at the front desk, to the super quick shuttle service, to the fantastic beds, pillows and blankets, to the delicious smelling amenities, to the comfortable size of our room, to the cool decor and comfortable chairs and couches in the lobby, to the smooth and almost silent elevators, and everything else about our stay at this hotel - there is nothing I can complain about and everything to compliment.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AnneKay9
Reviews.Content: Members of my extended family stayed here for a wedding weekend, and I could not have been happier. I travel for work a lot, and wish every hotel I stayed in could be this perfect. Room was large, clean, quiet, and very well decorated. Great flat screen TVs and iPod docking station. Comfy bed. Fitness center had everything I needed, and TVs on the cardio equipment. Pool and jacuzzi looked nice although I did not have time to use them. We ate in the restaurant a lot, and the service was delightful. The breakfast buffet was nice. Food was decent. Two minor complaints: the cab service is extremely spotty and slow. The hotel should warn guests to call for cabs well in advance. We asked the front desk to call a cab, and 30 minutes later he was still not there. Hotel should be aware of this problem and sort it out for guests. Also, a very kind person at the front desk, with the excellent intention of helping my parents with an early check in, referred to them as an "elderly couple." They found it embarassing.

Reviews.Title: “Not anywhere near 4 Star Quality”
Reviews.Author: superdave2k
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly disappointed in my stay at Le Meridien. The service was poor. No one offered to carry our bags, no door man, check-in attendant rude. When we got to the room the A/C didn't work. They came to "fix" it, still didn't work. I was offered no compensation. The room in general looked 'tired'. I will not stay here again. I paid almost $200 for a large suite for the night. Better off staying at a Holiday Inn than this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rooms, expensive service.”
Reviews.Author: CaseKas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a relaxing weekend in Dallas. If you want to shop this is a great location; however if you want to relax, not so much. The valet parking always seems understaffed here because it is mandatory. The room was as clean as to be expected, but the bed was harder then what we like. The restaurant/bar's waitress seemed less then happy to be there and the food is nothing to brag about. Our room service breakfast was on time, but cold. Who wants to eat cold eggs and English muffins? The indoor pool is tucked away at the bottom corner and gets to a max depth of about five feet.

Reviews.Title: “Starwood? Really?”
Reviews.Author: brensmi214
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel for a girls night away and was excited before I got there. We were looking forward to being close to the Galleria and staying at a Le Meridien Hotel. However what we experienced was not anything I have seen from a Starwood Hotel. Didn't mind the parking as much as the lack of service from the get go. Valet was ok, but not quick enough due to the fact that it was mandatory Valet parking. Front desk seemed too busy to help and more pre occupied with their own issues then checking us in. Room was great, nice open lay out, liked the TV and spacious feel. On a previous visit, it seemed cleaner. We went to the bar/restaurant to get a drink before we headed out and service was better than the front desk. Maybe b/c it was group of girls wanting to have fun. The bartender was friendly, but didn't really seem to pay attention to us. We did notice there were ladies who seemed to be soliciting "inappropriate services" which was uncomfortable. We left quickly after that. Upon returning that night we noticed the hallways were cluttered with room service trays and glasses that we almost tripped over. We walked into the room and went to sleep. The beds were comfortable, but a little hard. We tried to use the bathroom, there are four of us in the room, and the toilet wouldn't work. We called, but nothing was resolved, awesome! That morning at checkout we told the front desk what had happened, but got an "I'm sorry" and "Thank you for staying with us" We asked to speak to a Manager, waited about 10 minutes and no on came so we left. All in all this was not what we expected for a relaxing girl's night out. I have stayed at several Starwood properties throughout the US (including other Le Meridiens) and this was a major disappointment... especially since I have stayed here back in September and was looking forward to a return visit. It was much different in service and the hotel seemed generally cleaner. We will probably not return and suggest to our friends and family to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars? Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: Iemma
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 1 night at Le Meridien, had never tried the Priceline game, so we gave it a shot. If this is what Priceline considers a 4-Star hotel, I would urge them to check again. The hotel is beautiful, large rooms with good (though hard) beds. The customer service left much to be desired. The $20 mandatory parking was a surprise, so what was supposed to be an $79 room was immediately more than we expected, but for $79, that didn't hurt too badly. The employees were less than friendly, and the bartender was downright rude to me. I spent 20 years in the service industry, so I understand the pressures of bartending. This guy needs to find another profession. I can overlook lots of things, but not rude employees. The only person who even bothered to smile or act like she was interested in how our stay was, was the gal at the registration desk the morning we checked out. A call to fix our TV was finally canceled after they neglected to respond after 45 minutes (no movies). Room was borderline clean. I've stayed in more 3 and 2 star hotels than I have 4 and 5 star---but overall, in my opinion, this one doesn't deserve quite that many. stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, room was too warm, though.”
Reviews.Author: Mrsrobot
Reviews.Content: My husband selected this hotel for a post-Christmas mini vacation. We liked most aspects of this hotel: The room was spacious; the staff was very helpful and friendly; the shampoo, conditioner and shower gel were wonderful; the location is amazing if you like to shop. Our biggest complaint would be that we couldn't get our room temperature below 72 degrees, which is way too hot to sleep comfortably. We were on the 11th floor, so maybe it was an issue of all the heat rising to the highest point. We could have called the front desk, but decided to tough it out since our stay was so short. The only other negative was the $20 fee for valet parking. We got such a great deal on the room that we didn't mind it too much - we would have liked to know in advance that it was mandatory. And since the wireless Internet was free (most hotels charge $10-15 a night) we recouped the valet parking cost.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here -- but not near the elevators!”
Reviews.Author: remyone
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I stayed at this hotel since the remodel. The usual disappointing part of the stay is the mandatory valet daily fee of $20, but after getting the room as such a discounted price, this is usually overlooked easily. The entire hotel has a very modern feel, and has a great atmosphere overall. On this particular stay, I was placed in room 1003 (three doors away from the elevator on the 10th floor). All through the night, we could hear the noise (or vibration) of the fast elevator zipping up and down. It was weird because it was louder in the room than in the hallway in front of the door. Before arriving at the hotel this time, I did read a few reviews that mentioned the elevator hum, but figured they were just being dramatic -- and I was wrong. This hum seemed very minor until you try to sleep while air and heat are not blowing. It's nearly impossible. My alternative solution at 3am was to turn the A/C fan switch to "on", but to my surprise, there is no such option. Other than the three-day roar of the elevator, the stay was very enjoyable. We tried to dine at the bar area Christmas Eve night (assuming it would be hard to find anything open), but after looking at the elegant menu, decided to get up and go find something normal to eat. I also visited the business center during this stay and was very impressed that everything actually worked correctly, as in so many hotels, there's usually something out of order. I would recommend this hotel to a friend (or even to myself in the future), but only if the room booked is at least 50 yards away from the elevator! :)

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Coolest hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: alynnox
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for so cheap I couldn't believe it (direct from hotel website). We got a 600 something sf suite for $125. This place has so much wow factor. Very modern & minimalist decor (so if you don't like that be warned). Amazing amount of space & trendy everything from lobby to room. Also a great location if shopping at The Galleria (we weren't). Very short drive to everything, including Target, Ruth Chris & Pete's Dueling Piano Bar (a must ). This is my favorite hotel I have ever stayed in. Wish I had stayed longer & had a chance to spend more time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not the greatest service.”
Reviews.Author: gerialexander
Reviews.Content: The good news? If you like to shop, this is an excellent place to stay. Across from The Galleria, it's an easy walk. And right down the road, also within walking distance are a lot of other great shops. The rooms are big, but they are very contemporary and pretty basic. Our room did have a refrigerator which is always a plus. The bar was fine, and they were generous with the alcohol in my drinks. Again, always a plus. The bad news? As others have said, the parking. When I pulled up to drop off my friend and our stuff and attempted to go somewhere else to park, I was told I absolutely had to valet park and could not park anywhere else. That $20 cost added on to the room per day makes it more than I would have wanted to spend to stay here. The thermostat stinks. Ours said it was 68.5, and there was just no way. It is nice that the pool is indoors, because you can get in year round. But they could do something to spruce up the area. It is not relaxing at all and smells horribly like chlorine. Overall, this hotel is okay, but it's not a 4 star. The best thing going for it is its location for sure.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel proves that a mediocre hotel affects your trip”
Reviews.Author: SDP_MSN
Reviews.Content: A benefit of this hotel is that it is across from a huge mall-- so if your aim is to shop, this is very convenient. But the quality of the hotel is poor. Although the lobby looked very stylish and rooms were spacious, we were extremely disappointed with our visit. Our room did not have ANY drawers. . .I have never before stayed in a hotel room with no drawer space and cannot imagine what the designers were thinking. There were two shelves (one on the night table between the beds and one small one under the TV. But they were both open, so visitors to the room would see one's laundry. They were also low and dark, making it a pain to find a pair of socks. The sheets were cheap and not soft, the room had a minibar that was totally empty, cups in the bathroom were plastic. The rooms seemed cheaply built in terms of noise. We found it difficult to sleep as noise from the hallways was very loud at night. Most annoying was that our room was never made up! We came home late at night (after 10pm) and found the room had not been served. At breakfast the next morning, we learned that other guests had the same experience. We got a good rate at this hotel-- about $70 a night. I guess you get what you pay for-- and I wouldn't pay a nickel more for this place. The Westin one block away is far superior and worth the price difference.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best.”
Reviews.Author: jrs
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to me to be trying to be what it's not. What it is is a reasonably-priced tourist hotel next to a popular mall. What it is not is a luxury property, or even a comfortable one. The room was poorly soundproofed; we heard guests in the hall and elevators going up and down all night. Except when the HVAC was on, which was remarkably loud. The room lacked a dresser or drawers for putting things away. Most unfortunately, our room did not receive any cleaning service - we had to call at 10 PM to ask to have someone come to tidy the bathroom. Attempts to make the property funky (huge TV, nifty wallpaper, etc.) did not compensate for noise and lack of service. I'd take the latter over the former any day.

Reviews.Title: “Rock hard bed and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: BrowniePapi
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again! After using Hotwire to reserve the hotel, with their feature where you do not see the hotel name/info until you pay, I began doing research on the hotel. I was VERY disappointed to find that the hotel requires you to pay $20 for a MANDATORY valet parking. When asking the "Guest Services" employee, over the phone, about this policy she was very short with me and quite rude. The manager said he'd "take care of things", but did absolutely nothing - so he's just as useless as she was. We had a bottle of wine, as we were celebrating our anniversary, but had forgotten to bring a wine opener. We called down to the front desk, and my wife spoke to a manager who said it would be no problem to get the opener up to our room. Over 1 1/2 hours later I called back and was told one would be sent right up - which it was, 30 minutes after that call. Aside from all of that, the bed was as hard as my cheap $200 mattress I sleep on at home - my wife and I both woke up in pain. This hotel is extremely medicore in quality, and extremely dirt poor in service. I will NEVER ever stay there again - and will make sure and tell anyone I know to stay away as well. Word of mouth can kill a business.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms, Parking not free.”
Reviews.Author: EVETIL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and the rooms are large. You can name your own price but everytime you need something you will be reminded who you booked with. Parking will be added to your bill whether you parked there or not so be sure to examine it before you leave. You can park across the street in the Galleria Parking garage and just walk across the street. Swimming pool and hot tub extremely small in the basement. Walls are pretty thin also but we just left the fan on. Bathroom and living area were large and roomy. Don't ask for specific bed types, they won't let you choose those. Did have a large couch someone could sleep on though. Not a bad place to stay if you get it for cheap!

Reviews.Title: “horrible buisness managment”
Reviews.Author: cspinks11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meridien this weekend for a friends bachelorette party. When we checked in the staff was friendly and very helpful, then they switched shifts. We ended up at the hotel at 2am and got the rudest looks coming in the hotel......sober. The bachelorette herself had gotten shrimp in her taco that she is highly allergic to. While riding up the elevator with her to get her medicine, she got sick and vomited. we let the front desk know what happened and instead of asking if she was ok charged our room $250 for destruction of property that they failed to inform us of until we went to check out. The front desk manager (Mike) then proceeded to inform me very loudly that had it been just her being sick, there would not have been a fee but since he is apparently a medical personnel and "knew" she was drunk it was a fee. He would not listen to any of us and laughed in our faces in front of other customers standing at the front desk. When asked what the elevator was cleaned with since we had scrubbed the carpet on our knees with soap and water, he informed us that they had scrubbed it with soap and water. So we paid a $250 charge for our own cleaning. This is the worst hotel I have stayed at in my life. I would not even recommend that my worst enemy stay here and put them through this kind of treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the toothpaste and Marie's smile”
Reviews.Author: Cove80
Reviews.Content: I do not travel all that often, but when I do I am looking for GREAT customer service and Le Meridien does not have it. From the moment to check in to the check out I was greeted with a head nod or sometimes nothing. The room....not bad...but the service was horrible. I did request toothpaste and I was told that it might be awhile because I am the only one down here??? Full service hotel and you are the only one working??? The positives - The server in the bar named Maria or Marie was wonderful, she was always smiling and making sure your drink was full. Location - It is right next to the Galleria Mall and the offices where I was attending business. Customer Service always tells the story and the story here is that this hotel is not recommened.

Reviews.Title: “CLASSY & CHIC”
Reviews.Author: Krys1913
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls getaway for my best friends birthday! This is such a beautiful and classy hotel! I love everything about it from the lobby to the glass elevators, to the super chic guestrooms! The bathroom was even gorgeous! But the best part of all... it's DIRECTLY ACROSS THE STREET FROM THE GALLERIA! I literally walked across the street to shop! How fabulous is that?!!

Reviews.Title: “Crappy and Completely Indifferent Staff”
Reviews.Author: AverageGuy86
Reviews.Content: Planned a "staycation" with my girlfriend for our anniversary and pricelined a room. I was excited to find a four star hotel at a good price and couldnt wait to check-in. From the first moment i had misgivings. The teenage looking kid that checked us in had never heard of a restaurant that was extremely close to the hotel and could not/would not offer us guidance as to whether driving was appropriate (no biggie). After returning from dinner, we decided to have a few drinks at the bar. It was about 1030pm when the fire alarm went off and the entire hotel evacuated. We waited outside (along with many other scared and confused people) for a while until finally a manager came out and said it was a false alarm. He offered no other explanation and most certainly did not offer anything for anyone's trouble. We decided to call it a night. Back in the room, both myself and my girlfriend had a terrible time trying to sleep (she didnt at all) because the thermostat wouldnt adjust and the room had no sound protection from an elevator that sounded like the death star preparing to fire.... when i brought up the elevator noise and the faulty thermostat the next morning (10/24/10), the short, female working the front desk's only reply was that, "[I] would know to ask not to be next to an elevator the next time [I] stayed." thanks to that moment of epically bad customer service, there will never be a next time. and ps. the men's restroom downstairs was filthy.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: TexasGal48
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next door to galleria mall so easy asscess to shopping. We paid $50 for this room on priceline and we have stayed in many 4* hotels in dallas through the years, but I must say this was one of my favorites. Usually when you get a room on priceline you get the rooms they don't want to give anyone else Not the case at this hotel. We were put in a suite on the top floor. Large room with furniture, nice flat screen tv, and the decor was amazing. The hotel was not large, but easy to access anything you needed. I will stay at this hotel again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “I was very impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: stm0041
Reviews.Content: I booked a night at this hotel for $58 on priceline. The hotel was fabulous. Room was very large, exceptionally clean, 42" LG flatscren high def TV, fridge and Keurig coffeemaker. Bed was exceptionally comfortable. Hotel only offers valet parking at $20 per night. Located across the street from the Galleria Mall if shopping is your thing. Plenty of great restaurants in the area. I was a little aprehensive about this hotel based on the other reviews but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Comfy, & Amazing”
Reviews.Author: uhpesh
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, I would not complain ever! A 4 star hotel with a one night stay for about 75 dollars. Normal price everywhere else was around 180 a night. Beautiful lobby, very open, beautiful European/modern look inside and out. Check/in desk was very small, I like seeing a long check in desk, with many people working behind it... Maybe it was Colombus day thats why it was understaffed. Otherwise everything was perfect at this hotel. Comfy beds nice showers, nice TV, couch, all the above. I rate it a 10/10 for price and sleep oh and the rooms we had were standard with a king size bed and it was really spacious! ONLY downfall is the valet parking, there is no free parking, and overnight parking is 20 bucks, but you can find free parking around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor representation of Le Meridien”
Reviews.Author: HCFIII
Reviews.Content: I booked this room via hot-wire and they are normally spot on with their star ratings... This was a huge miss... The hotel was not clean, they gym is a joke, no outdoor pool for sunning, the pool is indoors in a basement and reeks of chlorine. This stay was so bad, that even though I paid in advance for 4 nights, I checked out after only one night and stayed at another property... It was that bad and the hotel staff was not accommodating at all. There were only two vending machines and both were out of bottled water and they had none in the hotel... Would never recommend this hotel to anyone... At best this is a 3 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Hype”
Reviews.Author: obimon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were scheduled to stay at Le Meridien for a few days as part of a larger road trip across the southwest. We booked the hotel based off the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. But after staying only one night at this hotel, we had to check out and find other accommodations in Dallas. The problems started with the open concept of the hotel itself. Few reviews mention this, but the hotel is designed with an open-air concept that exposes most rooms to the expansive lobby/bar/elevator areas. The rooms are not sufficiently sound-proofed to limit the reverberant noises originating from the main floor. In fact, at 2am we heard a piece of silverware fall onto the lobby's marble floor from ten floors up. Not to mention earlier in the evening when we were subjected to loud music and crowd noise from the bar area. Bottom line, if noise is an issue for you...take note. Second, as a four-star property we expected the room to be immaculate. The bathroom floors had stray hairs in the corners; the walls and doors were worn and chipped. And the bathtub was far from new. There is a fridge in the room, but it doesn't work. Third, wireless internet service is complimentary, but when we arrived we were told that they were having server issues. In other words, no wifi anywhere in the hotel. They gave us an ethernet cord to connect in our room, but that did not work, either. The only place where the internet worked was in the business office on the main level, which was busy with fellow travelers checking their emails. The hotel staff had no idea if or when the wi-fi service would be back. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful, and some of these issues were certainly out of their control. In fact, they understood why we wanted to check out early. But it baffles us that this property can earn a four-star rating with the kind of noise and cleanliness issues we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “A fav place to stay when in Dallas, LARGE rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Lilusmom
Reviews.Content: When we have to do an overnight in Dallas, we usually select to stay at Le Meridien for a number of reasons. First, with a family of 5 the rooms are ginormous! There is plenty of room to move around, the bathroom is very large as well. We generally go online and "bid" for this property as it usually takes our very low bid for a 4 star property near the Galleria. Speaking of the Galleria, it's right across the street from Macy's parking garage. It is rather enjoyable to stroll the 50 yards to great shopping without having to fuss about a parking space. On the down side, all guests must valet park their car to the tune of $20 per night however, the valet staff are very friendly and helpful. There also are no fans in the very large bathroom. The ambiance is very European, little wonder since Le Meridien is also located in many European cities, including one in Paris. The decor of the hotel is au courant, with a black & white theme and purple accents. They had a composer create a 24 hour loop of music that is reflective of all cultures as well as environments. I've recommended this hotel to many people as the quality for the value can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: selrahc1967
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, right next door to the shopping of the Galleria. I stayed in a Suite which was very nice with a separate bedroom and living room, furnishings are all modern and hip. Living area had a large business desk area, couch and a 42" plasma. Bedroom had a queen sized super comfy mattress and a 32" lcd. The bathroom was a bit disappointing, the tub appeared old and stained. The lobby is brightly lit and clean, lots of sitting area as well. The staff was super friendly, the front desk agent let me use the business center at 2am which was nice. Main level also has a bar/restaurant that are combined into one. I had buffet breakfast with my rate, it was a bit disappointing. . I wanted to load up a plate and go back to my room but the lady told me she would have to charge me $20 to take my plate upstairs so I ate in the restaurant, Nothing tasted good except the coffee to be honest. Lower level has a pool and exercise center. A few downsides to this property though.... The hotel is valet only at $20 a day. You can park next door though at the galleria...Look for the Macy's entrance, it's maybe 100 feet from the hotel entrance. This was filled with cars at 3am and there is no posted "Tow Away" signs so it didn't appear to be an issue. The suites are nice but they are only 1 bed, to get 2 beds you have to stay in a regular room. I guess mainly cause the bedroom is too small for 2 beds. The Valet staff was very understaffed, It appears the valet guys are also the bellhops... At 930pm we had to wait 10 mins to get our car, when we left there were 9 cars in line for valet.

Reviews.Title: “Color me impressed...”
Reviews.Author: Ditdee74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Labor Day weekend 2010 just for a quick getaway to Dallas. I was very impressed! It was clean, elegant, and the service was very good. The location for leisure can't be beat. We walked 5 minutes and we were in the Galleria. The only downside was the apparent lack of circulating air in the room. It didn't seem like we could get the fan to come on. Also, the booking price was cheap, but by the time we parked for 2 nights, had room service and two meals, we spent an additional $170.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but with drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: kalamazootx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful with modern furnishings. The lobby and rooms are spacious and light-filled. The hotel desk clerks are friendly and helpful. The valets are courteous. The housekeeper never came to my room eventhough I called the front desk at 11:00 am to let them know I was vacating the room for the day and they could service it. When I arrived back at 5pm I had no clean towels and no coffee,etc. I called the front desk to ask that they come now. The room was tidied up and clean towels left,however, nothing was actually cleaned. The guy only brought a bag of towels and a bar of soap with him. I had to call them back for clean drinking cups and coffee. I tried to buy a cocktail at noon but no one was working in the bar so I decided to eat lunch in the restaurant. Again no one at hostess stand and no employees anywhere to be found. So opted for the grill area instead. Again no one there to serve me. So I walked elsewhere to eat. They don't tell you at checkin that the valet service is mandatory and you will be charged $20/day for it. They have no self parking. So any money you save on booking on-line is eaten up with the valet charge. I will never stay here again because of the above reasons. It's a shame-hotel was pretty and nice inside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...even better price!”
Reviews.Author: hmm33502
Reviews.Content: I was thinking that all of the reviews that I saw and the rate I got were too good to be true.....I was WRONG! The hotel was very nice, the staff was helpful, responsive, and courteous. The room was HUGE considering the price we paid and similar hotels in the area. You do have to valet your car for $20 per day, but if you figure it into the price of the hotel, it is STILL a great deal, plus, who doesn't love valet? My girlfriends and I are definately going to stay there again and I am going to find the wall paper that they have in the restrooms and use it in my house.

Reviews.Title: “A model for SPG Platinum treatment - tried the rest but this the North Dallas best”
Reviews.Author: flyhigh1
Reviews.Content: As background, I travel 175 nights a year for work across the US, Europe, and Asia. Generally speaking I'm "all-business" when traveling - park/arrive, check-in (polite, speedy, and loyalty knowledgement is good; this plus either an acknowledgement of an attempted but unsuccessful upgrade/I'm sorry or un-asked for but presented upgrade as a platinum [both say we are trying and are well appreciated] is even better); gym time, maybe room service, sleep, maybe breakfast room service, check-out and then usually out the door" This hotel delivers on this... repeatedly. I've stayed in the Westin Park Central, Westin Galleria, Sheraton North Dallas, Sheraton Suites Market Center, Westin City Center, Aloft Dallas Downtown, and the W Dallas Victory and while some are semi-consistent in being good (W Dallas Victory and Aloft Dallas Downtown) the rest don't compare at all to the Le Meridien Dallas North. The location: Dallas North / Galleria area so if you have any business / access for The property: in good shape, newer, modern decor, consistently clean Value: consistently good, small but correctly equiped with the right high quality fitness center / pool (and I'm picky about this to get a good cardio and weights workout), good quite but nice / modern bar & restaurant The staff: PROFESSIONAL in capitals. The staff here consistently far exceeds that of any of the SPG properties in Dallas, they are polite, calm and unfrazzled (they seem to be very well trained and know their stuff), and efficiently execute (both what they are supposed to be doing, but also I can honestly say they have made good on every service promise they have made to me [wake-up calls, room deliveries, dry-cleaning, replacement of breakfast hang-tags, valet, room service]) So while i've stayed elsewhere before finding this gem the consistent service, SPG / Platinum recognition, and North Dallas convenience makes this a winner property for me. As a side - not sure how this hotel fairs with the leisure travelers since its not close to the core of Dallas but the feel of the hotel is calm and relaxed... admittedly it doesn't have the "resort" amenities, but then again its not what the hotel is going for I don't think

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not much more...”
Reviews.Author: heathercade1
Reviews.Content: I recommended Le Meridien Dallas North to some of my out of town friends - my best friend lives next door @ Villa Piana - so the location was great & they could walk to the Galleria. First, they force you to valet even if you're not staying long. They need to have a row that people can park elsewhere if they want to. Second, the power kept going out & although they did apologize they could've offered free drink coupons for those of us hanging out at bar area. You could get your valet ticket validated by bartender, but the evening valet acted rude about it - trust me, wish I had the tip money back. I sent an email to the Le Meridien with no response back on these issues. I also didn't realize that they allow pets, I don't think I will ever stay there knowing that.

Reviews.Title: “Just average but wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Chellebell
Reviews.Content: I love Le Meridien and choose to stay here while passing through as the Westin I usually stay at had a very high rate for the evening. I paid a rate of 179 and was rather disappointed when I looked into Starwoods in the area two days later and found the same room for 79. At 179 this property was a poor value. Likes: Everyone at the property was very, very nice. Mir at checkin was quick, pleasant and professional. The valets and the guy who brought up room service were very nice. Being upgraded with my SPG Preferred status. The room was very quiet. Good location with easy access to 635 and North Dallas Tollway. The valet did get me bottled water for my drive when I asked. Dislikes This property is old and lacks the charm (local art, funky decor) of other Le Meridiens I've visited. Room service meal was not very good. I know not to expect 5 star, but I did not even eat my salad as the dressing was very mayo-y....like mostly mayo, gross. Also, they delivered the wrong dessert. But I was too tired to call down and ask them to exchange it. Also, they only brought one set of silverware, napkin for the two of us. I LOVE Le Meridiens bath products, but my bottle marked lotion actually contained shampoo. The towels were very scratchy. Paying to park (20). I could easily have parked my own car in the lot right by the front door. I rate this property as average because it is nothing special. I would stay again if I was able to find a good rate but now I know it is not worth paying in the high 100's range.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: clkc86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend away. Found a great prepaid rate on the Starwood website. Since is was such a reasonable rate we booked a suite! Check-in was fast and efficient, as was the valet parking. Since we are Starwood Preferred Guest members we were on one of 2 floors for SPG members. Our suite was a corner room on the 10th floor. There was a large living room with doors into the bathroom and bedroom. Had a large sofa, refrigerator, bar height desk with 2 stools. The bedroom was small and the closet was not huge but was big enough for a weekend. There are no drawers for storage at all, so could be a challenge for a longer stay. The bathroom was OK, tub/shower combo, toilet and a single sink vanity. Not ultra luxurious but clean and efficient. Free wi-fi was available and seemed to work just fine. We tried room service for a late lunch. It arrived very quickly and the burger and fries we ordered were really good. Service in the bar was quick and efficient, but it should have been as we were nearly alone there. We never saw more than a handful of people there over this weekend, they were obviously not very full. Also tried the breakfast buffet, it was fairly good for a hotel breakfast. Service was good and attentive in the dining room. I don't really understand a trend I am noticing in recent hotel stays; there is not a lot of printed information in the room about the hotel. I suppose it is a green trend, but I like having a hard copy of what the hotel offers, when, where, and so on. The phone in the room has a single button to push for service which is answered quickly, but some things you hate to call about, ie, where is the pool, what are the hours, hours of the restaurant, etc. As mentioned by other reviewers, the only parking option is valet. Since the hotel was not full it never took long at all to get the car retrieved. All staff members we encountered were friendly and helpful. One guy, (Keith?) made restaurant recommendations and reservations for us. There are some great hotels is Dallas and this one is really good too. I would certainly stay here again if I needed to be in this part of town again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant and memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Nathantran
Reviews.Content: The hotel locates at the center of one of the best shopping and dining areas of Dallas with the Galleria across the street and all fine cuisine restaurants within walking distance. Hotel lobby is extremely spacious with contemporary European decor that gives guests a warm yet upbeat feeling. The room is definitely big and contemporary. The hotel offers free wireless internet and the service is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “You make 'Family Time' bearable!”
Reviews.Author: jack28houston
Reviews.Content: Having previously lived in Dallas, the Galleria area isn't exactly an area I would have chosen to stay. However, this was a belated Mothers Day get together and the area was close to my brothers place, as well as being easy to navigate to for my mother. Check-in was efficient, courteous and helpful. I had booked two rooms but the gentleman was not able to find them next to each other, as a matter of fact they were on the exact opposite side of the hotel from each other. Thank you for that!! (did I mention the other room was for my mother?? I kid, I kid, but seriously, could you put her on a different floor please??) The rooms are nice and spacious with room to entertain guests if need be. The flat screen lcd can be extended out and positioned to face the sitting area or the sleeping area. The mini fridge in the room does work, don't let them tell you different. It seems they are in the process of setting them up for minibar service and probably do not want people getting to comfortable with them being empty. However, the one complaint I have about the rooms is that one of them had black marks all over the walls. This is something I noticed in the hall ways as well. It's as if someone went through with luggage carts chipping off the plaster on the corners, and marking up the rest. In both cases house keeping should have made some sort of an attempt to clean and cover up. The decor is bright and modern, and it's a shame to let these things detract from that. On the same note, they have these modern looking hanging lights next to the bed. It's a set of three and one was broken with a bulb out in another. Again, these small details might give the impression that they are over looking other things as well. In the lobby there is a very nice bar/meeting place for you and your guests to enjoy a drink. It's nice that its out in the open and not hidden away, and by how many people were constantly there, it seems they agree. Nothing leisurely about the pool though. Unfortunately, it's an indoor pool and when I went to check it out I was very disappointed. I could hear the screams of small children and when I opened the door I couldn't hear myself think. All of this was cause by two small children and an adult. For this reason I can not recommend this hotel if you are looking forward to relaxing poolside. Overall this is a great hotel if you need a place in the area and are not looking at it as being a romantic weekend getaway or anything. A business trip or family get together/meeting place better suit this hotel. Thanks again Le Meridien, I survived yet another family event! p.s. the hotel is already a great deal, but using priceline will make it a steal!

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: amoore4017
Reviews.Content: Pros- Good food; we chose to eat in the bar area, as did most people. - Slept like logs; tho we were on a lower floor we did not hear any disturbances. - Hip Decor - Close to SHOPPING; right next to the Galleria. - Centrally located; Jct 635-dallas north tollway. - Large room, large bathroom, big TV - Staff was accomodating and presented well. Cons- Our first single room was on the second floor.. the furthest from the elevator and the phone didn't work. I adv. the staff that we had booked a double. We were moved fairly quickly tho we had to wait for a room to be prepaired .. at 9 pm. The second room was as we ordered tho in need of attention to the carpet,the scuffs on the walls, and the coffee maker . I chalked all of this up to the fact I had received a cut-rate on the room so they gave me a cut-rate room. - Valet Parking is presented as mandatory for $20 per night. Room rate made this bearable. Caveat- Coffee maker not working was OK because we ordered room service anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway from all the hustle of Dallas yet a short drive to everything in the city!”
Reviews.Author: harryo2b
Reviews.Content: One of the primary reasons for choosing this hotel was that it allowed pets to stay for no fee and we were very familiar with the name with our stays in Europe. We managed to get a superb deal on the rooms for two nights so this chance couldn't be passed up. Location was excellent for our needs. North Dallas is perfectly situated just down the road from Addison (which is home to restaraunt row, Belt Drive) and only about 10-15 mins from downtown Dallas. If you're significant other is into the finer things in life there is the Galleria directly across the street from the hotel and about 8 mins down the highway is North Park Center with both malls home to many big name designer stores. The hotel itself was great. Upon driving up to the main entrance we were greeted by the valet staff who provided the whole treatment and were very professional in handling of our car/luggage. The main lobby is large and spacious with up to date contempary decor. Front counter staff were quick and polite in readying a room for us prior to the 3 PM check-in time. Room itself was one of the largest I've stayed in for a 4 or 5 Star hotel with couch, lounge chair, 42" flat panel tv, bar style counter and matching stools all carrying the same theme as the main lobby. Overall I'd recommend it, look around and as suggested by other reviews look for third party booking agents to save a few $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ElmCityAfficionado
Reviews.Content: I must have just arrived in a cranky mood the last time I stayed here, because this time everything was great. My room was so spacious and hip, I felt like i was in a one-bedroom bachelorette pad. Everyone was very helpful, friendly, and professional - from the bell staff to the front desk to the restaurant. I spent hours at the huge Galleria mall directly across the street. And my room was quiet -- i slept like a log. Meanwhile, it's about half the price you would pay for all of this elsewhere. So i'm now a fan.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: MissPrecious
Reviews.Content: Room was pretty nice. Air conditioning was kind of loud, but it didn't keep me up at night so it was no big deal. It might be a problem for a light sleeper, though. My hubby loved the 42'' TV. My main observation with this hotel was the service. There were some staff that went above and beyond, but others seemed like they were at the end of their shift and just ready to get out of there. I do want to give a special thank you to the valet gentleman who drove us to our restaurant almost 15 minutes away after the woman at the front desk forgot to call us a taxi like she said the would. Normally, that kind of mistake wouldn't really bother me, but on several occasions I observed this lady flirting with another employee and I feel like we would have made our reservation on time if her mind wasn't elsewhere... Anyway, I don't know the valet's name, but he's a black gentleman in his 50's and he was working at 9pm on the night of Saturday, April 10th. Anyway, the proximity to the galleria mall was great, the bartender was awesome, and the room was spacious and comfortable. I'll consider this place when I visit Dallas again next month.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, great time.”
Reviews.Author: Surge_of_Power
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. It's located directly across the street from the Galleria, and was no more than 20 minutes from all the different activities we planned for the weekend. Location: A The hotel itself looked very new, fresh and clean with a modern decore. We stayed on the 9th floor and our room was spacious, with a nice view of the surrounding city. The beds were comfy, the floorplan open, the decore nice and new, and there was a large 42" flat panel TV mounted to the wall that swiveled out to accomodate just about any location in the room. Hotel & Room Condition: A Service for the most part was pretty standard. The front desk was friendly and did their jobs well. Nothing above and beyond, but still good. The valets were friendly and fast. Service: B Parking was not ideal. They only offer valet parking. No self park. This tacks on an additional $20/per day + taxes + tips. As mentioned above, the valets were friendly and fast, but if this is mandatory, just include it in the room rate. The way they have it makes it feel a bit deceptive. Parking: D We were gone most of the day doing various activities. Each afternoon when we got back we found that housekeeping had not arrived yet. For whatever reason (the hotel was far from full), their schedule had them stopping by around 4-5pm, which was inconvenient. Once there, they did a very thorough job. Housekeeping: C The room comes with complimentary wifi. Service was very spotty. 50% of the time it didn't work at all. Another 40% of the time it was incredibly slow. The last 10% it worked adequately, but still not very fast. Connectivity: D Overall, I think the pluses (hotel condition, room, decore, cost) far outweigh the minuses (valet cost, hotel schedule, wifi), and I would still recommend this hotel. Good hotel in a great location for a great price. Hotel Rating: B

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: BB7HotSprings_AR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on Friday and Saturday nights. The hotel was located very well for our needs. The property itself is ooutstanding. Very stylish. Everything works. The staff was very friendly, efficient and helpful. Booked thorough Expedia on Tuesday before arriving on Friday. The price was very low. Less than those suburban substandard motels. Note: valet parking is required and serviced very well. Never had to wait for the car. One of the gest hotel experiences I have had anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, contemporary large hotel - fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: catread99
Reviews.Content: We had no idea what location to choose in Dallas however the Meridien located just across the street from the Galleria shopping centre was a great choice. It was easily accessible on the I635 (the northern ring road), about 25 minutes ($40) in a cab from DFW airport and with easy routes by car into the centre of town and other attractions including the roads to Fort Worth. Rooms were excellent, very contemporary, roomy with nice big TV and sofa. Our only complaint was that we were located near the elevators and could here them whirring but with such bad jet lag I slept through it most of the time! You can pay a bit more to be further away from the lifts but they were not too much of a porblem, particularly as we paid only $80 per night including breakfast and use of the pool, gym and jacuzzi. The breakfast selection was not huge, but was of great quality and very fresh. All of the staff were so friendly we would highly recommend this hotel for excellent value contemporary hotel, business or pleasure. You need a car to get around Dallas, Hertz has an office in the Westin hotel just over the road and were cheap at $120 for 4 days. The only issue is that the Meridien has valet only parking at $20 a day, so park your car over the road in the Galleria shopping centre for free! Would highly recommend the Oceanaire restaurant adjacent to the Westin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Need Function over Design”
Reviews.Author: JPSmith20012
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently taken over by Starwood and renovated into their Le Meridien product. They should have left well enough alone. It appears that they were trying to attract the business traveler as they removed the walls between the living area and bedroom and created one large room, thereby removing the chance of attracting families. This would be fine but they forgot to ask the business traveler what they wanted. Instead of function they opted for design. While attractive, it is not practical. The lighting is extremely poor, not one bulb appears to be over 40 watts and everything is a spot light. The work area is no longer a desk but a counter with metal chairs, very uncomfortable. The lobby area is cold and again lacks appropriate lighting. Finally, the housekeeping needs some training and attention, past guests writing on documents illustrate this. Coffee makers dont work properly and response from desk is less than apologetic. Considering their occupancy, it might have been beneficial to consult with real business travelers before renovating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbsolutelyLBG
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night at Le Meridien but it was a great stay. The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was very comfortable. The decor is modern and the hotel was clean. The only negative is the $20 valet fee.

Reviews.Title: “With style by Ikea, why so expensive?!”
Reviews.Author: Books-n-Smeefy
Reviews.Content: I was excited about staying here during an overnight getaway. From the time you walk into the hotel, there is an overwhelming sense that everything is completely fake and staged. Its like an Ikea show room, from the furniture to the linens to the wall paper. The supposedly lush rooms felt like they were put together overnight. The bathroom was atrocious!!! The tile floor was disgusting and the bathtub/ shower was tiny! I woke up the next morning feeling even more exhausted because of the poor quality bed. To make matters worse, the staff (with the exception of the valets who were very nice) was off-standish and snotty. If I am paying 200 plus for a one night stay, It should be wonderful. I shouldn't feel like I don't deserve to be in the hotel. Over all I would never suggest Le Meridien to friends and I will NOT be staying here again. It sucked!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but attention to details is lacking”
Reviews.Author: mommy1215
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Meridien for a Saturday night and found the hotel to be decent. It is very modern with loud music blasting upon arrival in the valet parking area - it would have been more soothing to have toned it down a bit. Everyone was friendly at checkin and the bellhop was very nice. This is a remodeled Embassy Suites and they have done a nice job of making the rooms spacious and more modern. They funtion very well for a family. However, for a full service hotel, this hotel is lacking in their attention to detail. We called housekeeping to bring us plastic cups three times in an hour and they finally arrived 1.5 hours later - note there were none in our room upon checking in. The bathtub in one of our rooms was stained yellow which was not very pleasing. There were only two bath towels in a room with two double beds. There were no instructions of how to access the internet (note that it is free wireless which is nice). In my mother's room, the clock was set an hour ahead and the alarm went off twice at 5am and then at 6am which was not a nice way to sleep in. In any event, for a cheap price, this hotel is acceptable. It is personal taste but I would prefer to spend $50 more and stay somewhere more soothing like the Westin Galleria. Also note that the valet parking is $20 and there is not another option.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: lruthompson
Reviews.Content: My sister and I and our two children stayed at Le Meredien on a recent trip to celebrate my daughter's birthday. It was trendy and appealing to all of us. The staff were helpful and fun. Although the hotel is not necessarilly geared toward children we were made to feel welcome w/them in tow (although they are well behaved). We had breakfast at the restaraunt which was excellent. There was no children's menu,per se, but when we ordered for the children the waiter did suggest a "child's portion" which was more than enough for them and less expensive. The location can't be beat. It is in North Dallas/Addison near the Galleria and World Market and a lot of great restaraunts. The room was excetptionally clean,comfortable and chic..

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service. Manager does not seem to care...”
Reviews.Author: DallasLawyer91
Reviews.Content: Steve Holcomb, the manager of the location has wholly failed to respond to a very detailed complaint re: the insulting and embarrassing treatment received there by my friend and me. My email to Mr. Holcomb reads in part: "I have traveled throughout the world's major cities for business and pleasure and I have never felt so ignored and reviled by waitstaff as I felt at your establishment. The bartender's obvious, serial misstatements and "missteps" - that there was no champagne, then that were no flutes, then that there was only Rose sparkling wine, then his failure to ice the bottle - were merely additional slights after the waitress pointedly ignored Ms. Choi and me, despite our position a mere two feet away from two other patrons to whom she was very attentive. The young lady even sighed audibly when I asked her for water in my refusal to continue the ruse that she did not work there and could not help us." The food and beverage manager says he cannot identify the female server despite him having worked in the kitchen that night and there being only one server in the area. My message to Mr. Holcomb continued: "It sickens me to believe that the treatment Ms. Choi and I received was in any way related to us being the only minority occupants of the bar area at that time (I am Black and she is of Asian descent). Ms. Choi is relocating to Dallas from California later this year. I am particularly embarrassed because I took great pains to assure Ms. Choi that Dallas is NOT the South of old and that she would be treated with more civility and overt friendliness here than that which is generally afforded people in Manhattan, Los Angeles, or other large U.S. cities. I admit that I was wrong in my assertion, at least as to your staff on this occasion. I cannot apologize to her enough, but really, YOU should be doing that." Mr. Holcomb has not responded. I'm disgusted by the lack of concern that he does not have the time or interest to address a situation in which I was intended to feel unwelcome. This is the kind of situation in which I hope that I am wrong, and that the behavior of the staff is attributable to some other reason. BUT, the fact that I have not received any response from the general manager in my mind leads me to believe that he does not care what motivated the horrible actions/inactions of his staff.

Reviews.Title: “My "go-to" hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Jchgo972
Reviews.Content: I visit Dallas for work often and have stayed here over 8 times. I personally like this hotel for a few reasons: * I get an amazing rate on hotwire.com every time * Convenient location for my work * Rooms are huge - feels like a mini apt * Have never had bad service (although bartender was once a little off putting) * Front desk people (especially Fancy) are courteous, helpful and welcoming * Modern design but comfortable * Parking attendants are always hustling and professional (and funny) * Free WiFi - very important when you are a business traveler * sometimes when you book a room on a discount site, you may get a bad room or lowered service - NEVER at this hotel. I am sure this place is not for everyone but for the rate I get this is an amazing deal for me. The only problem I have ever had was that I had a broken bed - literally broken. They moved us promptly to a corner suite and checked in on us the next day. Am staying again next week.... and recommended it to all my coworkers.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Overall in Dallas...By Far !!..Very,Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: neptune007
Reviews.Content: We always visit Dallas on our leisure trips through Texas being from North Carolina and we can't say enough good things about this great Hotel that starts right from checking in. Arriving early from Austin we were able to check in around 10am and this is rare in most Hotels, because other "chain" Hotels have this silly policy it seems that they don't want you checked in until 3pm for whatever reason,but here everything was smooth and accomodating. What makes a Hotel is the Staff,which includes everyone from the top down and how they treat you and here the friendliness is outstanding.From the Front Desk Manager to the housekeepers we were always greeted with great Texas hospitality. If you need a shuttle ride,the drivers are very hospitable and effecient on driving you to your destination and picking you up.That's rare again in a Shuttle Service. The music played in the Lobby..newly renovated by the way..accents the chic decor,very pleasant upon entering too.The rooms are very cleanand large, has a comfy couch..with a nice size 42" TV ,and comfortable beds that you really don't want to get out of in the morning,and the BEST aspect is that the room had a fresh scent,again rare in most Hotels.The Bathroom..has two doors to enter,and you can imagine the space it provides,one of the largest we have encountered traveling all over the country. I rarely put a great Review on Trip Advisor,but being honest,you can't go wrong staying here whether it be Business or Leisure.By the way..the World Famous Galleria..is walking distance right across the street for the people who love their shopping. All in all..you will surely enjoy your stay here when in Dallas! You may find other "cheap" Hotels up the road..and we did in a past trip it was terrible stay at that,but you get what you pay for, so I do recommend staying here,trust me you will enjoy it.. By the way..the Business Center is state of the class and the workout area will get you a decent workout..go there everyday for mine. In this newly renovated Hotel,they did a great job. Come here and experience a claasy,chic,and most friendly Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location...”
Reviews.Author: Charis16
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place close to the Galleria this is it. It is directly across the street from the Galleria which is awesome because then you don't have to fight for a parking space at the mall. Downside - all parking at the hotel is valet and overnight for that is $20. The valet is quick, friendly and so are the bellmen. The hotel is also secure. After hours you need your key just to get in the main lobby doors. The elevator also requires a key and you can only navigate to your floor, the lower level (pool, fitness equipment) and the main floor. The check-in was quick and they were quick to change us from a double room (priceline.com) to a king suite at the first request. The room was decorating to beautifully in a chic decor. The bathroom is large and wonderfully decorated to match the rest of the room. The TV is huge. It has directly beneath is all sorts of "hook-ups" for AV wires, VGA cables, etc. We attached a VGA cable from my laptop to the TV and watched DVDs. We didn't try the room service and kept a Do Not Disturb sign out so I can't comment on those. The one thing I did love was the free business center. I was able to print our boarding passes and maps for the region we would be traveling to without spending a penny. Hole punch, stapler, color printer, even a how-to book for the computers operating system. Check-out was fast and easy. I didn't see any ants that the other reviews mention (something I was worried about - in fact I didn't see a single bug). Overall is was a nice experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: TXTerrytexas
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and efficient checkin, and got checkout extended by an hour. Great large room, clean, no problems. In-room coffee service with real creamer. Avoided the valet parking by parking at the Red Garage opposite - it was safe and lighted all night. I would stay here again! TH

Reviews.Title: “The Dump of Dumps”
Reviews.Author: ILTheDuke
Reviews.Content: So I arrived and checked in. Upon entering my room, I found the safe in the room was just laying in the floor of the closet not actually secured to the stand. My AC unit was also making loud grinding noises. So I called down and talked to the clerk about the safe and he agreeed itwas funny, as he told me no rooms on my floor should have safes yet. So I switch rooms for the AC problem and I am given a new room which was supposed to have a safe. To make a long story short,' the AC was working properly, the new room was also missing a safe, and I did apppreciate the two bottles of free water that were on offer in the room. The only problem is one of the bottles was already half consumed and not by me. My bathroom tile was disgusting, with black dirt caked to the grout of all the traffic areas and renovation of this room was just hack, as they changed certain aspect of the decor but left scratched wand warn plumbing fixtures. At this point I didn't want to expend the energy to swicth yet again, so I gave up. The service for breakfast was abysmal. My advice to you'all, just skip this placei!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: tamekay
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice "looking" hotel, but dont let the smooth taste fool you. The place is a lemon that is nicely decorated. Nothing worked! The toilet in my second room kept over flowing every time we used it! When they finally sent someone to fix it (after several request), I was told that he was not sticking his hand in the toilet so if it had to be done, my party and I better start gathering volunteers right then I was in sheer horror at the hotels staffs non chalant attitude. After the so called fix, the thing overflowed again and no one ever came. The toilet was still overflowed at the time we checked out of the room. There were ants in the room also. When I complained to the manager, she comped one of the two rooms I'd rented. Now here I am three days after checkout, looking at my credit card statement showing I was charged again for both rooms that I prepaid before I ever checked in. They never credited my account back for the comped room and actually charged me again! Rediculously poor services and a terrible experience. Do not subject yourself to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for family with 3 children!”
Reviews.Author: Bellair90
Reviews.Content: I spend AGES trying to find hotels that will accomodate all of us in one room. I had to call the hotel directly to book as their central booking number wouldnt book us all for "fire regulations" but i had read a review that said there were 5 in a room. The hotel happily arranged for a roll out bed to come in. The rooms are large, modern and the hotel is lovely. Breakfast was included and was sufficient if not a little boring. However, for the opportunity to be staying directly across from The Galleria and over the road from furniture and homeware stores (Hardware Restoration, Crate and Barrel, The Container Store) I certainly wont be complaining about breakfast. We will definitely be staying there again. The GAlleria carpark is directly across the road and is open 24 hours - save yourselves the $20 parking and stay there instead. I read about this in a review and took the advice - worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: eddievan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend and found the room and the facilities to be wonderful. The hotel is very comfortable throughout. The rooms are huge and the TVs are 42 inch plasmas!! The pool was freezing cold but nice and the workout room is ok (not very big or much equipment) The best part about the hotel was the staff. They were all very friendly and professional at every moment. Beware -the parking is 18 dollars per day. You can park across the street at the Galleria mall for free but the hotel will charge you anyway. I did get them to remove that charge very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard to be hip - mandatory $18 per day valet parking”
Reviews.Author: L8sho
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice place. Beware discount travelers. You can book a room at this hotel for a competitive price online. Realize that there is only valet parking at a rate of $18 per night. There is also no vending onsite. Bring drinks and snacks or be prepared to pay at the mini bar or room service. Otherwise, the place is really nice. It is upscale and hip. The furnishings are reminiscent of IKEA style (but higher quality). I found the provided "premium" shampoos and conditioners not to be up to the hype. A coworker had to go buy their own. I found them satisfactory, but I am a short-haired male. Sometimes the hotel seems to be trying a little too hard to be hip. There is odd ambient music in the elevators. Many times I boarded the elevators with a guest that had just checked in. The look on their face when a soundtrack of chicken sounds started playing was priceless. The business center is lackluster. There are Macs that aren't fully functional (once again, hip over practicality). Also, the fax in the business center doesn't work. The rooms feature a very hand bar with stools, as well as a large flat screen tv that can be angled to any viewing position in the spacious room. Wireless internet access is marginal in the rooms. It works fine in the lobby. If you are going to need full speed internet access in the room, I suggest bringing a long cable. I like to browse while laying in bed, but my 10ft. cable wasn't long enough. On off-peak days, the wireless in the room was usable. I would consider other places if I am in Dallas on business again, but if my mission was romance with the wife, there are few places better in Dallas than the Le Meridien. It is directly across the street from the Galleria Mall, so it's also perfect for shoppers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing service!!!”
Reviews.Author: alohamariss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Meridien for a night with friends in September and enjoyed every moment of it. From the moment we arrived we were treated so well! With a wonderful greeting by the valet then a fast and friendly check-in (we also enjoyed picking out our own custom room key!). The room was very large with 2 extremely comfortable double beds, flat screen tv, and a lounge area with a large couch. Also, the close proximity to the Galleria is great, we enjoyed the mall quite a bit. 2 comments about the service- after a night out in Downtown Dallas my friends and I were craving some late night snacks and the room service menu didn't have much that appealed to us at the time. Since we had been drinking we were sort of stuck were we were!! We called the front desk and they suggested that we have the valet drive us to wherever we wanted to get food and then bring it back, which he happily did! I have never heard of such a thing but it was incredibly thoughtful and convenient! Also, the next morning I went downstairs to the lobby in hopes of getting some coffee and breakfast with my friend. Unfortunately the bar area had stopped serving food but we asked a man in the area and he said he would have whatever we wanted brought out to us. So, my friend and I sat in the lobby (in those great whimsical chairs) and had a leisurely morning filled with conversation, coffee, and wonderful service. I would not hesitate to go back when I return to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: XtinaY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Meridien Dallas for 3 nights for work. The hotel was recently renovated and it is very trendy and nice. I got a 2 bed suite and the room is huge. It's nicely decorated and things are clean and neat. The hotel is right next to the Galleria mall which is good. If you are willing to walk a bit you will see a CVS somewhere. The bar and restaurant are right down stairs where you can see from your floor. It's fun to look down but it gets pretty noisy at night. The other complain is that you have to go with their valet parking which cost you 18 bucks per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: SPGPlatHick
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for a handful of times now, and though the bathroom floors could be a bit cleaner (hair, water stains), I have found the hotel to be a very comfortable place to stay with large rooms, great toiletries (Cinq Mondes), and quiet. The suites are usually very tidy, and bright. The staff is usually very accommodating. The only thing that I would like that other Le Meridiens offer as a service is a free shoe shine and Financial Times which are not available. The gym is very nice, but the smell of the chlorine from the neighbouring pools could cause some nausea. There is also no self parking available. If you're looking for a hotel with less foot traffic, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Somebody really thought about putting this place together”
Reviews.Author: Johnawc1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only been open about 6 months, so it still has the new feel. More importantly, the hotel is really well thought out. If you have ever stayed in a room that was work unfriendly, you know what I mean. The room is perfectly laid out with a large work area. There is a wide screen at the end of the work area. There is plenty of room to relax as well. As for an INSIDE room. it is quieter and it provides you a view of everything in the lobby for who is at the bar to your car being pulled up by the valet. It is ideally located close to the Galleria and many great restaurants. The staff is exceptional. They went out of their way to make sure that all was going well. This will be our base location in Dallas from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: jumlah
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal from hotwire. Parking is $20, so we took the advise of another posting and parked at the galleria parking lot - literally across from the the hotel. The garage is open 24 hrs and open access. The garage is connected with Macy's directly. One note - when dropping off family, make sure you tell the bell boy you are not parking. I was charged the overnight parking charge for simply leaving my car in front for checking in and checking out. I called them and they corrected it. The rooms are spacious, we were ok with 3 kids.

Reviews.Title: “A real discovery-superb service, great location and truly affordable.”
Reviews.Author: candCalifornia
Reviews.Content: A unique, boutique-like hotel located in North Dallas across the street from the Galleria Mall and near area businesses. Le Meridien offers free wi-fi, a chic decor and an experience like no other. Rooms are really large, great flat screen T.V., comfortable bed and awesome service. People were friendly, informative and really eager to share the "philosophy of Le Meridien".

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: We were attending an event at the convention center, and did not want to pay downtown prices, so we looked for a hotel that was a bit further out. The Le Meridien was just fantastic. It took only 10-15 minutes to get to downtown and is directly across from the mall and several restaurants. It is also within walking distance to a movie theater. Our check in process was perfect. There is a constant "clean" smell as you walk into the hotel, and everything looks just very "crisp". Tony at the front desk made sure to take very good care of us. Our room was ready right away. When we went to our rooms, they were both just wonderful. There is nothing that I can think of to make them any better. They too were very "crisp and clean". While staying at the hotel. The handle on my shower needed to be repaired. It was done within five minutes of me informing the front desk. The hotel is very modern, and it seems that there is nothing that has been overlooked. There is free wi-fi throughout the hotel, and free computers in the lobby to use. The staff made the stay. The would totally bend over backwards for the guests. We will stay here again for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Modern hotel, cold and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: jennifitz
Reviews.Content: Took a weekend away- wonderful location, directly across the street from Macy's entrance to the Galleria. Greeted by friendly valet, met with a modern chic decor in atrium. Upon checking in, we asked for availability for complimentary upgrade- he looked at my starwood card, and proceeded to tell me that according to my card they did not have one available, but if I had a platinum card, upgrades are automatic. That's fine- we got what we purchased- a pleasantly large nicely decorated room. Within minutes of entering our room, we found several stains on the sheets, and rogue hairs in tub. Everything else looked spotless, and I do have high standards of cleanliness, so we let it pass. Pool area a disappointment, no windows, cold 'heated', small, greasy pool with 2 lounge chairs. Next morning we have coffee in our in-room coffee maker, husband goes downstairs to request more caffeinated coffee. Representative behind desk informs husband she is 'so sorry' but they ran out of coffee last night. Husband asks for restaurant voucher for free coffee, the representative disappears into managers office for 5 minutes, and comes back from manager's office with 'Oh, look, you're in luck, we just found some'. Our stay felt like corners were cut on cleanliness and coffee, staff was not accommodating, and pool felt slightly dirty. Watch out for the taxes- our total was $11.00 more than our room 'total' b/c of Dallas Convention Center Area taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Love the window treatment, very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: andres21st
Reviews.Content: Right across the street from the Galleria, shopping for the ladies, great window treatment in the lobby, very open, staff very attentive quick check in, huge rooms in a suite layout, two huge HD plasma flat screens, Heavenly Beds, and Lilly coffee, what more do you need, oh and a great rate

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: stefanwt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Le Meridien Dallas North and I give them a 10! All the staff, including the velet guys were extremely friendly and courtious. The rooms are wonderfull with not alot of junk that you don't need or won't even see during your stay. Comfortable beds, clean bathrooms and the hotel is very chic but not snobby. Room service was great and the food came within a reasonable time and everything was satisfactory. Even when I ordered breakfast at 330 am it was as I ordered it and the wait staff was pleasant. There is a charge for valet parking but it is certainly worth it especially when it's 900 degrees outside. Plus you have in and out privilages throughout your stay and if you have visitors or collegues who come to the hotel for dinner or drinks with you, their valet is complimentary. In all I HIGHLY recommend this property. Compared to some of the other similar priced hotels in the area, you get a whole lot more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: sandracarte
Reviews.Content: First of all, we got this hotel at a steal price from priceline.com one fourth of price that its advertised in some places. the rooms are very very spacious, they are decorated so beautifilly. i love the colors! we parked in the red garage across the street to save even more money. ( i'm afraid the high price valet parking is gonna turn people off, and its a shame because the place is great! I hope thats not the reason there seemed to be more employees there than guests :( . the exercise equipment in the exercise room is very new and up to date! we had fun exercising in there. the pool area smelled too strong of chorine for me to try it.but it all looked very clean. the coffee was great, but clearer instructions would have been good.Just put the whole container in there, dont take off the lid:) Oh and the TV , awesome! The bed was so comfortable! I slept better in that bed than i have in a long time. This would be a great hotel for a bunch of girlfriends to go if they were doing vacation together or an overnight shopping spree, because the Galleria Mall is arcoss the street and it was the largest mall I've ever been in. 3 floors with skating rink in the middle. Or if you are a fellow , this would be a great place to take your spouse and go over to the Mall and get some Godiva candy for her :) I'm talking right across the street! we had to spend our last night at the Westin at the airport, which was supposed to be a 4 star and it was such a big let down after staying at the LeMeridian. I would recommend this to others!

Reviews.Title: “Too chic to be comfortable”
Reviews.Author: eswarner
Reviews.Content: It's stylish and chic - but the rooms are not functional. There's no written material about the hotel in the room -really! I guess you are supposed to be so hip that your intution allows you to figure out the amenities yourself. There is not a single drawer in the room - really! There no self-parking in a suburb with an open lot outside - really! It's so obvious the mandatory $18 valet charge daily is for revenue and not for guest convenience. There is literally no place to store clothes that don't hang. So staying here for 3 days out of a suitcase was a pain and the large room look cluttered. The lack of storage was so bad that the extra toilet paper is on the closet shelf with the hairdryer. The only storage are three open shelfs in some furniture. It's nice to have a high large desk with two bar stools - but the metal chairs are so uncomfortable that I'd rather work on the floor. The bed linens are great, but the bath linens are nothing special, if you can get housekeeping to bring any.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms and great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: defresh
Reviews.Content: This was a cool place to stay. The rooms were huge with a nice bathroom, refrigerator, nice pull out LCD TV, couch - living area, and okay bed. The staff seemed very young and inexperienced. They were not rude just seemed a little unsure of things. Had a slight issue at check in but it eventually got handled. The $18 parking would suck but you can park just across the street in the galleria parking lot for free and seems safe. There is plenty to do and lots of places to eat at the galleria as well which was a big benefit. We did not swim however the pool is indoor and looked like a nice well kept area. Overall I would for sure stay here again and this should be rated a 4 star easily. I will try and book again soon!

HotelInfo.Name: Le Meridien Dallas by the Galleria
HotelInfo.Address: 13402 Noel Rd., Dallas, TX 75240
